47 //============================================================================
48 /// Complete LU solve (overwrites RHS with solution). This is the
49 /// generic version which should not need to be over-written.
50 //============================================================================
51 void DoubleMatrixBase::solve(DoubleVector &rhs)
52 {
53 #ifdef PARANOID
54  if(Linear_solver_pt==0)
55  {
56  throw OomphLibError("Linear_solver_pt not set in matrix",
57  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
58  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
59  }
60 #endif
61 
62  // Copy rhs vector into local storage so it doesn't get overwritten
63  // if the linear solver decides to initialise the solution vector, say,
64  // which it's quite entitled to do!
65  DoubleVector actual_rhs(rhs);
66 
67  //Use the linear algebra interface to the linear solver
68  Linear_solver_pt->solve(this,actual_rhs,rhs);
69 }
70

144  Linear_solver_pt = Default_linear_solver_pt = new DenseLU;

191 //============================================================================
192 /// LU decompose a matrix, by using the default linear solver
193 /// (DenseLU)
194 //============================================================================
195 void DenseDoubleMatrix::ludecompose()
196 {
197  //Use the default (DenseLU) solver to ludecompose the matrix
198  static_cast<DenseLU*>(Default_linear_solver_pt)->factorise(this);
199 }

221 //============================================================================
222 /// Determine eigenvalues and eigenvectors, using
223 /// Jacobi rotations. Only for symmetric matrices. Nothing gets overwritten!
224 /// - \c eigen_vect(i,j) = j-th component of i-th eigenvector.
225 /// - \c eigen_val[i] is the i-th eigenvalue; same ordering as in eigenvectors
226 //============================================================================
227 void DenseDoubleMatrix::eigenvalues_by_jacobi(Vector<double> & eigen_vals,
228  DenseMatrix<double> &eigen_vect)
229  const
230 {
231 #ifdef PARANOID
232  // Check Matrix is square
233  if (N!=M)
234  {
235  throw OomphLibError(
236  "This matrix is not square, the matrix MUST be square!",
237  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
238  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
239  }
240 #endif
241  // Make a copy of the matrix & check that it's symmetric
242 
243  // Check that the sizes of eigen_vals and eigen_vect are correct. If not
244  // correct them.
245  if (eigen_vals.size()!=N)
246  {
247  eigen_vals.resize(N);
248  }
249  if (eigen_vect.ncol()!=N || eigen_vect.nrow()!=N)
250  {
251  eigen_vect.resize(N);
252  }
253 
254  DenseDoubleMatrix working_matrix(N);
255  for (unsigned long i=0;i<N;i++)
256  {
257  for (unsigned long j=0;j<M;j++)
258  {
259 #ifdef PARANOID
260  if (Matrixdata[M*i+j]!=Matrixdata[M*j+i])
261  {
262  throw OomphLibError(
263  "Matrix needs to be symmetric for eigenvalues_by_jacobi()",
264 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
265  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
266  }
267 #endif
268  working_matrix(i,j)=(*this)(i,j);
269  }
270  }
271 
272  DenseDoubleMatrix aux_eigen_vect(N);
273 
274  throw OomphLibError(
275  "Sorry JacobiEigenSolver::jacobi() removed because of licencing problems.",
276  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
277  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
278 
279  // // Call eigensolver
280  // unsigned long nrot;
281  // JacobiEigenSolver::jacobi(working_matrix, eigen_vals, aux_eigen_vect,
282  // nrot);
283 
284  // Copy across (and transpose)
285  for (unsigned long i=0;i<N;i++)
286  {
287  for (unsigned long j=0;j<M;j++)
288  {
289  eigen_vect(i,j)=aux_eigen_vect(j,i);
290  }
291  }
292 }

295 //============================================================================
296 /// Multiply the matrix by the vector x: soln=Ax
297 //============================================================================
298 void DenseDoubleMatrix::multiply
299 (const DoubleVector &x, DoubleVector &soln) const
300 {
301 #ifdef PARANOID
302  // Check to see if x.size() = ncol().
303  if (x.nrow()!=this->ncol())
304  {
305  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
306  error_message_stream
307  << "The x vector is not the right size. It is " << x.nrow()
308  << ", it should be " << this->ncol() << std::endl;
309  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
310 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
311  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
312  }
313  // check that x is not distributed
314  if (x.distributed())
315  {
316  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
317  error_message_stream
318  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for DenseDoubleMatrix "
319  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
320  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
321 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
322  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
323  }
324  // if soln is setup...
325  if (soln.built())
326  {
327  // check that soln is not distributed
328  if (soln.distributed())
329  {
330  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
331  error_message_stream
332  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for DenseDoubleMatrix "
333  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
334  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
335 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
336  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
337  }
338  if (soln.nrow() != this->nrow())
339  {
340  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
341  error_message_stream
342  << "The soln vector is setup and therefore must have the same "
343  << "number of rows as the matrix";
344  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
345 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
346  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
347  }
348  if (*x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt() !=
349  *soln.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt())
350  {
351  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
352  error_message_stream
353  << "The soln vector and the x vector must have the same communicator"
354  << std::endl;
355  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
356 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
357  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
358  }
359  }
360 #endif
361 
362  // if soln is not setup then setup the distribution
363  if (!soln.built())
364  {
365  LinearAlgebraDistribution dist(x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt(),
366  this->nrow(),false);
367  soln.build(&dist,0.0);
368  }
369 
370  // Initialise the solution
371  soln.initialise(0.0);
372 
373  // Multiply the matrix A, by the vector x
374  const double* x_pt = x.values_pt();
375  double* soln_pt = soln.values_pt();
376  for (unsigned long i=0;i<N;i++)
377  {
378  for (unsigned long j=0;j<M;j++)
379  {
380  soln_pt[i] += Matrixdata[M*i+j]*x_pt[j];
381  }
382  }
383 }
384

386 //=================================================================
387 /// Multiply the transposed matrix by the vector x: soln=A^T x
388 //=================================================================
389 void DenseDoubleMatrix::multiply_transpose(const DoubleVector &x,
390  DoubleVector &soln) const
391 {
392 #ifdef PARANOID
393  // Check to see if x.size() = ncol().
394  if (x.nrow()!=this->nrow())
395  {
396  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
397  error_message_stream
398  << "The x vector is not the right size. It is " << x.nrow()
399  << ", it should be " << this->nrow() << std::endl;
400  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
401 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
402  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
403  }
404  // check that x is not distributed
405  if (x.distributed())
406  {
407  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
408  error_message_stream
409  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for DenseDoubleMatrix "
410  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
411  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
412 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
413  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
414  }
415  // if soln is setup...
416  if (soln.built())
417  {
418  // check that soln is not distributed
419  if (soln.distributed())
420  {
421  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
422  error_message_stream
423  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for DenseDoubleMatrix "
424  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
425  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
426 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
427  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
428  }
429  if (soln.nrow() != this->ncol())
430  {
431  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
432  error_message_stream
433  << "The soln vector is setup and therefore must have the same "
434  << "number of columns as the matrix";
435  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
436 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
437  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
438  }
439  if (*soln.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt() !=
440  *x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt())
441  {
442  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
443  error_message_stream
444  << "The soln vector and the x vector must have the same communicator"
445  << std::endl;
446  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
447 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
448  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
449  }
450  }
451 #endif
452 
453  // if soln is not setup then setup the distribution
454  if (!soln.built())
455  {
456  LinearAlgebraDistribution* dist_pt =
457  new LinearAlgebraDistribution(x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt(),
458  this->ncol(),false);
459  soln.build(dist_pt,0.0);
460  delete dist_pt;
461  }
462 
463  // Initialise the solution
464  soln.initialise(0.0);
465 
466  // Matrix vector product
467  double* soln_pt = soln.values_pt();
468  const double* x_pt = x.values_pt();
469  for (unsigned long i=0;i<N;i++)
470  {
471  for (unsigned long j=0;j<M;j++)
472  {
473  soln_pt[j] += Matrixdata[N*i+j]*x_pt[i];
474  }
475  }
476 }
477 
478 
479 
480 //=================================================================
481 /// For every row, find the maximum absolute value of the
482 /// entries in this row. Set all values that are less than alpha times
483 /// this maximum to zero and return the resulting matrix in
484 /// reduced_matrix. Note: Diagonal entries are retained regardless
485 /// of their size.
486 //=================================================================
487 void DenseDoubleMatrix::matrix_reduction(const double &alpha,
488  DenseDoubleMatrix &reduced_matrix)
489 {
490 
491  reduced_matrix.resize(N,M,0.0);
492  // maximum value in a row
493  double max_row;
494 
495  // Loop over rows
496  for(unsigned i=0;i<N;i++)
497  {
498  // Initialise max value in row
499  max_row=0.0;
500 
501  //Loop over entries in columns
502  for(unsigned long j=0;j<M;j++)
503  {
504  // Find max. value in row
505  if(std::fabs( Matrixdata[M*i+j])>max_row)
506  {
507  max_row=std::fabs( Matrixdata[M*i+j]);
508  }
509  }
510 
511  // Decide if we need to retain the entries in the row
512  for(unsigned long j=0;j<M;j++)
513  {
514  // If we're on the diagonal or the value is sufficiently large: retain
515  // i.e. copy across.
516  if(i==j || std::fabs(Matrixdata[M*i+j])>alpha*max_row )
517  {
518  reduced_matrix(i,j) =Matrixdata[M*i+j];
519  }
520  }
521  }
522 
523 }

526 //=============================================================================
527 /// Function to multiply this matrix by the DenseDoubleMatrix matrix_in.
528 //=============================================================================
529 void DenseDoubleMatrix::multiply(const DenseDoubleMatrix &matrix_in,
530  DenseDoubleMatrix& result)
531 {
532 #ifdef PARANOID
533  // check matrix dimensions are compatable
534  if ( this->ncol() != matrix_in.nrow() )
535  {
536  std::ostringstream error_message;
537  error_message
538  << "Matrix dimensions incompatable for matrix-matrix multiplication"
539  << "ncol() for first matrix:" << this->ncol()
540  << "nrow() for second matrix: " << matrix_in.nrow();
541 
542  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
543 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
544  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
545  }
546 #endif
547 
548  // NB N is number of rows!
549  unsigned long n_row = this->nrow();
550  unsigned long m_col = matrix_in.ncol();
551 
552  // resize and intialize result
553  result.resize(n_row, m_col, 0.0);
554 
555  //clock_t clock1 = clock();
556 
557  // do calculation
558  unsigned long n_col=this->ncol();
559  for (unsigned long k=0; k<n_col; k++)
560  {
561  for (unsigned long i=0; i<n_row; i++)
562  {
563  for (unsigned long j=0; j<m_col; j++)
564  {
565  result(i,j) += Matrixdata[m_col*i+k] * matrix_in(k,j);
566  }
567  }
568  }
569 }

578 //=======================================================================
579 /// \short Default constructor, set the default linear solver and
580 /// matrix-matrix multiplication method.
581 //========================================================================
582 CCDoubleMatrix::CCDoubleMatrix() : CCMatrix<double>()
583  {
584  Linear_solver_pt = Default_linear_solver_pt = new SuperLUSolver;
585  Matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
586  }
587 
588 //========================================================================
589  /// \short Constructor: Pass vector of values, vector of row indices,
590  /// vector of column starts and number of rows (can be suppressed
591  /// for square matrices). Number of nonzero entries is read
592  /// off from value, so make sure the vector has been shrunk
593  /// to its correct length.
594 //=======================================================================
595  CCDoubleMatrix::CCDoubleMatrix(const Vector<double>& value,
596  const Vector<int>& row_index,
597  const Vector<int>& column_start,
598  const unsigned long &n,
599  const unsigned long &m) :
600  CCMatrix<double>(value,row_index,column_start,n,m)
601  {
602  Linear_solver_pt = Default_linear_solver_pt = new SuperLUSolver;
603  Matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
604  }
605 
606  /// Destructor: delete the default linear solver
607  CCDoubleMatrix::~CCDoubleMatrix() {delete Default_linear_solver_pt;}
608

630 {

632  // Check to see if x.size() = ncol().
633  if (x.nrow()!=this->ncol())
634  {
635  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
636  error_message_stream
637  << "The x vector is not the right size. It is " << x.nrow()
638  << ", it should be " << this->ncol() << std::endl;
639  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
640 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
641  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
642  }

644  if (x.distributed())
645  {
646  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
647  error_message_stream
648  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for CCDoubleMatrix "
649  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
650  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
651 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
652  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
653  }
654  // if soln is setup...
655  if (soln.built())
656  {
657  // check that soln is not distributed
658  if (soln.distributed())
659  {
660  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
661  error_message_stream
662  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for CCDoubleMatrix "
663  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
664  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
665 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
666  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
667  }
668  if (soln.nrow() != this->nrow())
669  {
670  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
671  error_message_stream
672  << "The soln vector is setup and therefore must have the same "
673  << "number of rows as the matrix";
674  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
675 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
676  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
677  }
678  if (*soln.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt() !=
679  *x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt())
680  {
681  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
682  error_message_stream
683  << "The soln vector and the x vector must have the same communicator"

690 #endif
691 
692  // if soln is not setup then setup the distribution
693  if (!soln.built())
694  {
695  LinearAlgebraDistribution* dist_pt =
696  new LinearAlgebraDistribution(x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt(),
697  this->nrow(),false);
698  soln.build(dist_pt,0.0);
699  delete dist_pt;
700  }
701 
702  // zero
703  soln.initialise(0.0);
704 
705  // multiply
706  double* soln_pt = soln.values_pt();
707  const double* x_pt = x.values_pt();
708  for (unsigned long j=0;j<N;j++)
709  {
710  for (long k=Column_start[j];k<Column_start[j+1];k++)
711  {
712  unsigned long i = Row_index[k];
713  double a_ij = Value[k];
714  soln_pt[i] += a_ij*x_pt[j];
715  }
716  }
717 }
718 
719 
720 
721 
722 //=================================================================
723 /// Multiply the transposed matrix by the vector x: soln=A^T x
724 //=================================================================
725 void CCDoubleMatrix::multiply_transpose(const DoubleVector &x,
726  DoubleVector &soln) const
727 {
728 #ifdef PARANOID
729  // Check to see if x.size() = ncol().
730  if (x.nrow()!=this->nrow())
731  {
732  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
733  error_message_stream
734  << "The x vector is not the right size. It is " << x.nrow()
735  << ", it should be " << this->nrow() << std::endl;
736  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
737 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
738  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
739  }
740  // check that x is not distributed
741  if (x.distributed())
742  {
743  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
744  error_message_stream
745  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for CCDoubleMatrix "
746  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
747  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
748 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
749  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
750  }
751  // if soln is setup...
752  if (soln.built())
753  {
754  // check that soln is not distributed
755  if (soln.distributed())
756  {
757  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
758  error_message_stream
759  << "The x vector cannot be distributed for CCDoubleMatrix "
760  << "matrix-vector multiply" << std::endl;
761  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
762 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
763  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
764  }
765  if (soln.nrow() != this->ncol())
766  {
767  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
768  error_message_stream
769  << "The soln vector is setup and therefore must have the same "
770  << "number of columns as the matrix";
771  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
772 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
773  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
774  }
775  if (*soln.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt() !=
776  *x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt())
777  {
778  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
779  error_message_stream
780  << "The soln vector and the x vector must have the same communicator"
781  << std::endl;
782  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
783 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
784  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
785  }
786  }
787 #endif
788 
789  // if soln is not setup then setup the distribution
790  if (!soln.built())
791  {
792  LinearAlgebraDistribution* dist_pt =
793  new LinearAlgebraDistribution(x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt(),
794  this->ncol(),false);
795  soln.build(dist_pt,0.0);
796  delete dist_pt;
797  }
798 
799  // zero
800  soln.initialise(0.0);
801 
802  // Matrix vector product
803  double* soln_pt = soln.values_pt();
804  const double* x_pt = x.values_pt();
805  for (unsigned long i=0;i<N;i++)
806  {
807 
808  for (long k=Column_start[i];k<Column_start[i+1];k++)
809  {
810  unsigned long j=Row_index[k];
811  double a_ij=Value[k];
812  soln_pt[j]+=a_ij*x_pt[i];
813  }
814  }
815 }
816 
817 
818 
819 
820 //===========================================================================
821 /// Function to multiply this matrix by the CCDoubleMatrix matrix_in
822 /// The multiplication method used can be selected using the flag
823 /// Matrix_matrix_multiply_method. By default Method 2 is used.
824 /// Method 1: First runs through this matrix and matrix_in to find the storage
825 /// requirements for result - arrays of the correct size are
826 /// then allocated before performing the calculation.
827 /// Minimises memory requirements but more costly.
828 /// Method 2: Grows storage for values and column indices of result 'on the
829 /// fly' using an array of maps. Faster but more memory
830 /// intensive.
831 /// Method 3: Grows storage for values and column indices of result 'on the
832 /// fly' using a vector of vectors. Not particularly impressive
833 /// on the platforms we tried...
834 //=============================================================================
835 void CCDoubleMatrix::multiply(const CCDoubleMatrix& matrix_in,
836  CCDoubleMatrix& result)
837 {
838 #ifdef PARANOID
839  // check matrix dimensions are compatible
840  if ( this->ncol() != matrix_in.nrow() )
841  {
842  std::ostringstream error_message;
843  error_message
844  << "Matrix dimensions incompatable for matrix-matrix multiplication"
845  << "ncol() for first matrix:" << this->ncol()
846  << "nrow() for second matrix: " << matrix_in.nrow();
847 
848  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
849 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
850  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
851  }
852 #endif
853 
854  // NB N is number of rows!
855  unsigned long N = this->nrow();
856  unsigned long M = matrix_in.ncol();
857  unsigned long Nnz = 0;
858 
859  // pointers to arrays which store result
860  int* Column_start;
861  double* Value;
862  int* Row_index;
863 
864  // get pointers to matrix_in
865  const int* matrix_in_col_start = matrix_in.column_start();
866  const int* matrix_in_row_index = matrix_in.row_index();
867  const double* matrix_in_value = matrix_in.value();
868 
869  // get pointers to this matrix
870  const double* this_value = this->value();
871  const int* this_col_start = this->column_start();
872  const int* this_row_index = this->row_index();
873 
874  // set method
875  unsigned method = Matrix_matrix_multiply_method;
876 
877  // clock_t clock1 = clock();
878 
879  // METHOD 1
880  // --------
881  if (method==1)
882  {
883  // allocate storage for column starts
884  Column_start = new int[M+1];
885  Column_start[0]=0;
886 
887  // a set to store number of non-zero rows in each column of result
888  std::set<unsigned> rows;
889 
890  // run through columns of this matrix and matrix_in to find number of
891  // non-zero entries in each column of result
892  for (unsigned long this_col = 0; this_col<M; this_col++)
893  {
894  // run through non-zeros in this_col of this matrix
895  for (int this_ptr = this_col_start[this_col];
896  this_ptr < this_col_start[this_col+1];
897  this_ptr++)
898  {
899  // find row index for non-zero
900  unsigned matrix_in_col = this_row_index[this_ptr];
901 
902  // run through corresponding column in matrix_in
903  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col];
904  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col+1];
905  matrix_in_ptr++)
906  {
907  // find row index for non-zero in matrix_in and store in rows
908  rows.insert(matrix_in_row_index[matrix_in_ptr]);
909  }
910  }
911  // update Column_start
912  Column_start[this_col+1] = Column_start[this_col] + rows.size();
913 
914  // wipe values in rows
915  rows.clear();
916  }
917 
918  // set Nnz
919  Nnz = Column_start[M];
920 
921  // allocate arrays for result
922  Value = new double[Nnz];
923  Row_index = new int[Nnz];
924 
925  // set all values of Row_index to -1
926  for (unsigned long i=0;i<Nnz;i++)
927  Row_index[i] = -1;
928 
929  // Calculate values for result - first run through columns of this matrix
930  for (unsigned long this_col = 0; this_col<M; this_col++)
931  {
932  // run through non-zeros in this_column
933  for (int this_ptr = this_col_start[this_col];
934  this_ptr < this_col_start[this_col+1];
935  this_ptr++)
936  {
937  // find value of non-zero
938  double this_val = this_value[this_ptr];
939 
940  // find row associated with non-zero
941  unsigned matrix_in_col = this_row_index[this_ptr];
942 
943  // run through corresponding column in matrix_in
944  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col];
945  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col+1];
946  matrix_in_ptr++)
947  {
948  // find row index for non-zero in matrix_in
949  int row = matrix_in_row_index[matrix_in_ptr];
950 
951  // find position in result to insert value
952  for(int ptr = Column_start[this_col];
953  ptr <= Column_start[this_col+1];
954  ptr++)
955  {
956  if (ptr == Column_start[this_col+1])
957  {
958  // error - have passed end of column without finding
959  // correct row index
960  std::ostringstream error_message;
961  error_message << "Error inserting value in result";
962 
963  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
964  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
965  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
966  }
967  else if (Row_index[ptr] == -1 )
968  {
969  // first entry for this row index
970  Row_index[ptr] = row;
971  Value[ptr] = this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
972  break;
973  }
974  else if ( Row_index[ptr] == row )
975  {
976  // row index already exists - add value
977  Value[ptr] += this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
978  break;
979  }
980  }
981  }
982  }
983  }
984  }
985 
986  // METHOD 2
987  // --------
988  else if (method==2)
989  {
990  // generate array of maps to store values for result
991  std::map<int,double>* result_maps = new std::map<int,double>[M];
992 
993  // run through columns of this matrix
994  for (unsigned long this_col = 0; this_col<M; this_col++)
995  {
996  // run through non-zeros in this_col
997  for (int this_ptr = this_col_start[this_col];
998  this_ptr < this_col_start[this_col+1];
999  this_ptr++)
1000  {
1001  // find value of non-zero
1002  double this_val = this_value[this_ptr];
1003 
1004  // find row index associated with non-zero
1005  unsigned matrix_in_col = this_row_index[this_ptr];
1006 
1007  // run through corresponding column in matrix_in
1008  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col];
1009  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col+1];
1010  matrix_in_ptr++)
1011  {
1012  // find row index for non-zero in matrix_in
1013  int row = matrix_in_row_index[matrix_in_ptr];
1014 
1015  // insert value
1016  result_maps[this_col][row] +=
1017  this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
1018  }
1019  }
1020  }
1021 
1022  // allocate Column_start
1023  Column_start = new int[M+1];
1024 
1025  // copy across column starts
1026  Column_start[0] = 0;
1027  for (unsigned long col=0; col<M; col++)
1028  {
1029  int size = result_maps[col].size();
1030  Column_start[col+1] = Column_start[col] + size;
1031  }
1032 
1033  // set Nnz
1034  Nnz = Column_start[M];
1035 
1036  // allocate other arrays
1037  Value = new double[Nnz];
1038  Row_index = new int[Nnz];
1039 
1040  // copy values and row indices
1041  for (unsigned long col=0; col<M; col++)
1042  {
1043  unsigned ptr = Column_start[col];
1044  for (std::map<int,double>::iterator i = result_maps[col].begin();
1045  i != result_maps[col].end();
1046  i ++)
1047  {
1048  Row_index[ptr]= i->first;
1049  Value[ptr] = i->second;
1050  ptr++;
1051  }
1052  }
1053 
1054  // tidy up memory
1055  delete[] result_maps;
1056  }
1057 
1058  // METHOD 3
1059  // --------
1060  else if (method==3)
1061  {
1062  // vectors of vectors to store results
1063  std::vector< std::vector<int> > result_rows(N);
1064  std::vector< std::vector<double> > result_vals(N);
1065 
1066  // run through the columns of this matrix
1067  for (unsigned long this_col = 0; this_col<M; this_col++)
1068  {
1069  // run through non-zeros in this_col
1070  for (int this_ptr = this_col_start[this_col];
1071  this_ptr < this_col_start[this_col+1];
1072  this_ptr++)
1073  {
1074  // find value of non-zero
1075  double this_val = this_value[this_ptr];
1076 
1077  // find row index associated with non-zero
1078  unsigned matrix_in_col = this_row_index[this_ptr];
1079 
1080  // run through corresponding column in matrix_in
1081  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col];
1082  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_col_start[matrix_in_col+1];
1083  matrix_in_ptr++)
1084  {
1085  // find row index for non-zero in matrix_in
1086  int row = matrix_in_row_index[matrix_in_ptr];
1087 
1088  // insert value
1089  int size = result_rows[this_col].size();
1090  for (int i = 0; i<=size; i++)
1091  {
1092  if (i==size)
1093  {
1094  // first entry for this row index
1095  result_rows[this_col].push_back(row);
1096  result_vals[this_col].push_back(
1097  this_val*matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr]);
1098  }
1099  else if (row==result_rows[this_col][i])
1100  {
1101  // row index already exists
1102  result_vals[this_col][i] +=
1103  this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
1104  break;
1105  }
1106  }
1107  }
1108  }
1109  }
1110 
1111  // allocate Column_start
1112  Column_start = new int[M+1];
1113 
1114  // copy across column starts
1115  Column_start[0] = 0;
1116  for (unsigned long col=0; col<M; col++)
1117  {
1118  int size = result_rows[col].size();
1119  Column_start[col+1] = Column_start[col] + size;
1120  }
1121 
1122  // set Nnz
1123  Nnz = Column_start[M];
1124 
1125  // allocate other arrays
1126  Value = new double[Nnz];
1127  Row_index = new int[Nnz];
1128 
1129  // copy across values and row indices
1130  for (unsigned long col=0; col<N; col++)
1131  {
1132  unsigned ptr = Column_start[col];
1133  unsigned n_rows=result_rows[col].size();
1134  for (unsigned i = 0; i < n_rows ; i++)
1135  {
1136  Row_index[ptr] = result_rows[col][i];
1137  Value[ptr] = result_vals[col][i];
1138  ptr++;
1139  }
1140  }
1141  }
1142 
1143  // INCORRECT VALUE FOR METHOD
1144  else
1145  {
1146  std::ostringstream error_message;
1147  error_message << "Incorrect method set in matrix-matrix multiply"
1148  << "method=" << method << " not allowed";
1149 
1150  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
1151 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1152  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1153  }
1154 
1155  result.build_without_copy(Value, Row_index, Column_start, Nnz, N, M);
1156 }
1157 
1158 
1159 
1160 //=================================================================
1161 /// For every row, find the maximum absolute value of the
1162 /// entries in this row. Set all values that are less than alpha times
1163 /// this maximum to zero and return the resulting matrix in
1164 /// reduced_matrix. Note: Diagonal entries are retained regardless
1165 /// of their size.
1166 //=================================================================
1167 void CCDoubleMatrix::matrix_reduction(const double &alpha,
1168  CCDoubleMatrix &reduced_matrix)
1169 {
1170  // number of columns in matrix
1171  long n_coln=ncol();
1172 
1173  Vector<double>max_row(nrow(),0.0);
1174 
1175  // Here's the packed format for the new matrix
1176  Vector<int> B_row_start(1);
1177  Vector<int> B_column_index;
1178  Vector<double> B_value;
1179 
1180 
1181  // k is counter for the number of entries in the reduced matrix
1182  unsigned k=0;
1183 
1184  // Initialise row start
1185  B_row_start[0]=0;
1186 
1187  // Loop over columns
1188  for(long i=0;i<n_coln;i++)
1189  {
1190 
1191  //Loop over entries in columns
1192  for(long j=Column_start[i];j<Column_start[i+1];j++)
1193  {
1194 
1195  // Find max. value in row
1196  if(std::fabs(Value[j])>max_row[Row_index[j]])
1197  {
1198  max_row[Row_index[j]]=std::fabs(Value[j]);
1199  }
1200  }
1201 
1202  // Decide if we need to retain the entries in the row
1203  for(long j=Column_start[i];j<Column_start[i+1];j++)
1204  {
1205  // If we're on the diagonal or the value is sufficiently large: retain
1206  // i.e. copy across.
1207  if(i==Row_index[j] || std::fabs(Value[j])>alpha*max_row[Row_index[j]] )
1208  {
1209  B_value.push_back(Value[j]);
1210  B_column_index.push_back(Row_index[j]);
1211  k++;
1212  }
1213  }
1214  // This writes the row start for the next row -- equal to
1215  // to the number of entries written so far (C++ zero-based indexing!)
1216  B_row_start.push_back(k);
1217  }
1218 
1219 
1220  // Build the matrix from the compressed format
1221  dynamic_cast<CCDoubleMatrix&>(reduced_matrix).
1222  build(B_value,B_column_index,B_row_start,nrow(),ncol());
1223  }

1231 //=============================================================================
1232 /// Default constructor
1233 //=============================================================================
1234 CRDoubleMatrix::CRDoubleMatrix()
1235  {
1236  // set the default solver
1237  Linear_solver_pt = Default_linear_solver_pt = new SuperLUSolver;
1238 
1239  // matrix not built
1240  Built = false;
1241 
1242  // set the serial matrix-matrix multiply method
1243 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS
1244 // Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 4;
1245  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1246 #else
1247  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1248 #endif
1249  }
1250 
1251 //=============================================================================
1252 /// Copy constructor
1253 //=============================================================================
1254 CRDoubleMatrix::CRDoubleMatrix(const CRDoubleMatrix& other_matrix)
1255 {
1256  // copy the distribution
1257  this->build_distribution(other_matrix.distribution_pt());
1258 
1259  // copy coefficients
1260  const double* values_pt = other_matrix.value();
1261  const int* column_indices = other_matrix.column_index();
1262  const int* row_start = other_matrix.row_start();
1263 
1264  // This is the local nnz.
1265  const unsigned nnz = other_matrix.nnz();
1266 
1267  // Using number of local rows since the underlying CRMatrix is local to
1268  // each processor.
1269  const unsigned nrow_local = other_matrix.nrow_local();
1270 
1271  // Storage for the (yet to be copied) data.
1272  double* my_values_pt = new double[nnz];
1273  int* my_column_indices = new int[nnz];
1274  int* my_row_start = new int[nrow_local+1];
1275 
1276  // Copying over the data.
1277  std::copy(values_pt,values_pt+nnz,my_values_pt);
1278  std::copy(column_indices,column_indices+nnz,my_column_indices);
1279  std::copy(row_start,row_start+nrow_local+1,my_row_start);
1280 
1281 
1282  // Build without copy since we have made a deep copy of the data structure.
1283  this->build_without_copy(other_matrix.ncol(),nnz,my_values_pt,
1284  my_column_indices,my_row_start);
1285 
1286  // set the default solver
1287  Linear_solver_pt = Default_linear_solver_pt = new SuperLUSolver;
1288 
1289  // matrix is built
1290  Built = true;
1291 
1292  // set the serial matrix-matrix multiply method
1293 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS
1294 // Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 4;
1295  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1296 #else
1297  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1298 #endif
1299 }

1318 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS

1321 #else
1322  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1323 #endif

1327 //=============================================================================
1328 /// \short Constructor: Takes the distribution and the number of columns, as
1329 /// well as the vector of values, vector of column indices,vector of row
1330 ///starts.
1331 //=============================================================================
1332 CRDoubleMatrix::CRDoubleMatrix(const LinearAlgebraDistribution* dist_pt,
1333  const unsigned& ncol,
1334  const Vector<double>& value,
1335  const Vector<int>& column_index,
1336  const Vector<int>& row_start)
1337 {
1338  // build the compressed row matrix
1339  CR_matrix.build(value,column_index,row_start,dist_pt->nrow_local(),ncol);
1340 
1341  // store the Distribution
1342  this->build_distribution(dist_pt);
1343 
1344  // set the linear solver
1345  Linear_solver_pt = Default_linear_solver_pt = new SuperLUSolver;
1346 
1347  // set the serial matrix-matrix multiply method
1348 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS
1349 // Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 4;
1350  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1351 #else
1352  Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = 2;
1353 #endif
1354 
1355  // matrix has been built
1356  Built = true;
1357 }

1372 //=============================================================================
1373 void CRDoubleMatrix::build(const LinearAlgebraDistribution* distribution_pt)
1374 {

1376  this->build_distribution(distribution_pt);

1379 //=============================================================================
1380 /// \short Runs through the column index vector and checks if the entries
1381 /// are arranged arbitrarily or if they follow the regular lexicographical
1382 /// of matrices. If a boolean argument is provided with the assignment
1383 /// TRUE then information on the first entry which is not in the correct
1384 /// position will also be given
1385 //=============================================================================
1386  bool CRDoubleMatrix::entries_are_sorted(const bool& doc_unordered_entries) const
1387  {
1388 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
1389  // We only need to produce a warning if the matrix is distributed
1390  if (this->distributed())
1391  {
1392  // Create an ostringstream object to store the warning message
1393  std::ostringstream warning_message;
1394 
1395  // Create the warning messsage
1396  warning_message << "This method currently works for serial but "
1397  << "has not been implemented for use with MPI!\n";
1398 
1399  // Issue the warning
1400  OomphLibWarning(warning_message.str(),
1401  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1402  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1403  }
1404 #endif
1405 
1406  // Get the number of rows in this matrix
1407  unsigned n_rows=this->nrow();
1408 
1409  // Acquire access to the value, row_start and column_index arrays from
1410  // the CR matrix. Since we do not change anything in row_start_pt we
1411  // give it the const prefix
1412  const int* column_index_pt=this->column_index();
1413  const int* row_start_pt=this->row_start();
1414 
1415  // Loop over the rows of matrix
1416  for (unsigned i=0;i<n_rows;i++)
1417  {
1418  // Calculate the number of nonzeros in the i-th row
1419  unsigned nnz_row_i=*(row_start_pt+i+1)-*(row_start_pt+i);
1420 
1421  // Get the index of the first entry in row i
1422  unsigned i_row_start=*(row_start_pt+i);
1423 
1424  // Loop over the entries of the i-th row
1425  for (unsigned j=0;j<nnz_row_i-1;j++)
1426  {
1427  // Check if the column index of the following entry is greater than the
1428  // current entry
1429  if ((*(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j+1))<
1430  (*(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j)))
1431  {
1432  // If the input argument was set to TRUE we document we output information
1433  // of the first entry which is not in the correct position
1434  if (doc_unordered_entries)
1435  {
1436  // Tell the user
1437  oomph_info << "Matrix has not been correctly sorted!"
1438  << "\nOn row: " << i
1439  << "\nEntry: " << j
1440  << "\nEntry 1 = " << *(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j)
1441  << "\nEntry 2 = " << *(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j+1)
1442  << std::endl;
1443  }
1444 
1445  // It hasn't worked
1446  return false;
1447  } // if ((*(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j+1)) ...
1448  } // for (unsigned j=0;j<nnz_row_i-1;j++)
1449  } // for (unsigned i=0;i<n_rows;i++)
1450 
1451  // If it gets here without a warning then the entries in each row of
1452  // the matrix are ordered by increasing column index
1453  return true;
1454  } // End of entries_are_sorted()
1455 
1456 //=============================================================================
1457 /// \short This helper function sorts the entries in the column index vector
1458 /// and the value vector. During the construction of the matrix the entries
1459 /// were most likely assigned in an arbitrary order. As a result, it cannot
1460 /// be assumed that the entries in the column index vector corresponding to
1461 /// each row of the matrix have been arranged in increasing order. During
1462 /// the setup an additional vector will be set up; Index_of_diagonal_entries.
1463 /// The i-th entry of this vector contains the index of the last entry
1464 /// below or on the diagonal. If there are no entries below or on the
1465 /// diagonal then the corresponding entry is -1. If, however, there are
1466 /// no entries in the row then the entry is irrelevant and is kept
1467 /// as the initialised value; 0.
1468 //=============================================================================
1469  void CRDoubleMatrix::sort_entries()
1470  {
1471 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
1472  // We only need to produce a warning if the matrix is distributed
1473  if (this->distributed())
1474  {
1475  // Create an ostringstream object to store the warning message
1476  std::ostringstream warning_message;
1477 
1478  // Create the warning messsage
1479  warning_message << "This method currently works for serial but "
1480  << "has not been tested with MPI!\n";
1481 
1482  // Issue the warning
1483  OomphLibWarning(warning_message.str(),
1484  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1485  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1486  }
1487 #endif
1488 
1489  // Get the number of rows in the matrix
1490  unsigned n_rows=this->nrow();
1491 
1492  // Acquire access to the value, row_start and column_index arrays from
1493  // the CR matrix. Since we do not change anything in row_start_pt we
1494  // give it the const prefix
1495  double* value_pt=this->value();
1496  int* column_index_pt=this->column_index();
1497  const int* row_start_pt=this->row_start();
1498 
1499  // Resize the Index_of_diagonal_entries vector
1500  Index_of_diagonal_entries.resize(n_rows,0);
1501 
1502  // Vector of pairs to store the column_index of each value in the i-th row
1503  // and its corresponding matrix entry
1504  Vector<std::pair<int,double> > column_index_and_value_row_i;
1505 
1506  // Loop over the rows of the matrix
1507  for (unsigned i=0;i<n_rows;i++)
1508  {
1509  // Find the number of nonzeros in the i-th row
1510  unsigned nnz_row_i=*(row_start_pt+i+1)-*(row_start_pt+i);
1511 
1512  // Variable to store the start of the i-th row
1513  unsigned i_row_start=*(row_start_pt+i);
1514 
1515  // If there are no nonzeros in this row then the i-th entry of the vector
1516  // Index_of_diagonal_entries is irrelevant so we can simply let it be 0
1517  if (nnz_row_i==0)
1518  {
1519  // Set the i-th entry
1520  Index_of_diagonal_entries[i]=0;
1521  }
1522  // If there are nonzeros in the i-th row
1523  else
1524  {
1525  // If there is more than one entry in the row resize the vector
1526  // column_index_and_value_row_i
1527  column_index_and_value_row_i.resize(nnz_row_i);
1528 
1529  // Loop over the entries in the row
1530  for (unsigned j=0;j<nnz_row_i;j++)
1531  {
1532  // Assign the appropriate entries to column_index_and_value_row_i
1533  column_index_and_value_row_i[j]=
1534  std::make_pair(*(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j),
1535  *(value_pt+i_row_start+j));
1536  }
1537 
1538  // Sort the vector of pairs using the struct CRDoubleMatrixComparisonHelper
1539  std::sort(column_index_and_value_row_i.begin(),
1540  column_index_and_value_row_i.end(),
1541  Comparison_struct);
1542 
1543  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
1544  // Now that the entries of the i-th row have been sorted we can read them
1545  // back into value_pt and column_index_pt:
1546  //-----------------------------------------------------------------------
1547 
1548  // Create a boolean variable to indicate whether or not the i-th entry of
1549  // Index_of_diagonal_entries has been set
1550  bool is_ith_entry_set=false;
1551 
1552  // Loop over the entries in the vector column_index_and_value_row_i and
1553  // assign its entries to value_pt and column_index_pt
1554  for (unsigned j=0;j<nnz_row_i;j++)
1555  {
1556  // Set the column index of the j-th nonzero value in the i-th row of
1557  // the matrix
1558  *(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j)=column_index_and_value_row_i[j].first;
1559 
1560  // Set the value of the j-th nonzero value in the i-th row of
1561  // the matrix
1562  *(value_pt+i_row_start+j)=column_index_and_value_row_i[j].second;
1563 
1564  // This if statement is used to set the i-th entry of the vector
1565  // Index_of_diagonal_entries if it has not yet been set
1566  if (!is_ith_entry_set)
1567  {
1568  // If the column index of the first entry in row i is greater than the
1569  // row number then the first entry must lie above the diagonal
1570  if (unsigned(*(column_index_pt+i_row_start))>i)
1571  {
1572  // If the column index of the first entry in the row is greater than
1573  // the row number, i, then the i-th entry of Index_of_diagonal_entries
1574  // needs to be set to -1 to indicate there are no entries below or on
1575  // the diagonal
1576  Index_of_diagonal_entries[i]=-1;
1577 
1578  // Indicate that the i-th entry of Index_of_diagonal_entries has
1579  // been set
1580  is_ith_entry_set=true;
1581  }
1582  // If there are entries below or on the diagonal
1583  else
1584  {
1585  // If there is only one entry in the row then we know that this will
1586  // be the last entry below or on the diagonal because we have
1587  // eliminated the possibility that if there is only one entry,
1588  // that it lies above the diagonal
1589  if (nnz_row_i==1)
1590  {
1591  // Set the index of the current entry to be the value of i-th entry
1592  // of Index_of_diagonal_entries
1593  Index_of_diagonal_entries[i]=i_row_start+j;
1594 
1595  // Indicate that the i-th entry of Index_of_diagonal_entries has
1596  // been set
1597  is_ith_entry_set=true;
1598  }
1599  // It remains to now check the case that there is more than one
1600  // entry in the row. If there is more than one entry in the row
1601  // and there are entries below or on the diagonal then we have
1602  // three cases:
1603  // (1) The current entry lies on the diagonal;
1604  // (2) The current entry lies above the diagonal;
1605  // (3) The current entry lies below the diagonal;
1606  // The first case can easily be checked as done below. If the second
1607  // case occurs then we have just passed the last entry. We know this
1608  // because at least one entry lies on or below the diagonal. If the
1609  // second case it true then we need to assign the previous entry to
1610  // the vector Index_of_diagonal_entries. Finally, we are left with
1611  // case (3), which can be split into two cases:
1612  // (3.1) The current entry lies below the diagonal but it
1613  // is not the last entry below or on the diagonal;
1614  // (3.2) The current entry lies below the diagonal and is
1615  // the last entry below or on the diagonal.
1616  // If case (3.1) holds then we can simply wait until we get to the
1617  // next entry in the row and examine that. If the next entry lies
1618  // on the diagonal then it will be swept up by case (1). If the
1619  // next entry lies above the diagonal then case (2) will sweep it up
1620  // and if neither is the case then we wait until the next entry and
1621  // so on. If, instead, case (3.2) holds then our last check simply
1622  // needs to check if the current entry is the last entry in the row
1623  // because if the last entry lies on the diagonal, case (1) will
1624  // sweep it up. If it lies above the diagonal, case (2) will take
1625  // care of it. Therefore, the only remaining case is that it lies
1626  // strictly below the diagonal and since it is the last entry in
1627  // the row it means the index of this entry needs to be assigned
1628  // to Index_of_diagonal_entries
1629 
1630  // Case (1) : The current entry lies on the diagonal
1631  else if (unsigned(*(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j))==i)
1632  {
1633  // Set the index of the current entry to be the value of i-th entry
1634  // of Index_of_diagonal_entries
1635  Index_of_diagonal_entries[i]=i_row_start+j;
1636 
1637  // Indicate that the i-th entry of Index_of_diagonal_entries has
1638  // been set
1639  is_ith_entry_set=true;
1640  }
1641  // Case (2) : The current entry lies above the diagonal
1642  else if (unsigned(*(column_index_pt+i_row_start+j))>i)
1643  {
1644  // Set the index of the current entry to be the value of i-th entry
1645  // of Index_of_diagonal_entries
1646  Index_of_diagonal_entries[i]=i_row_start+j-1;
1647 
1648  // Indicate that the i-th entry of Index_of_diagonal_entries has
1649  // been set
1650  is_ith_entry_set=true;
1651  }
1652  // Case (3.2) : The current entry is the last entry in the row
1653  else if (j==nnz_row_i-1)
1654  {
1655  // Set the index of the current entry to be the value of i-th entry
1656  // of Index_of_diagonal_entries
1657  Index_of_diagonal_entries[i]=i_row_start+j;
1658 
1659  // Indicate that the i-th entry of Index_of_diagonal_entries has
1660  // been set
1661  is_ith_entry_set=true;
1662  } // if (nnz_row_i==1) else if
1663  } // if (*(column_index_pt+i_row_start)>i)
1664  } // if (!is_ith_entry_set)
1665  } // for (unsigned j=0;j<nnz_row_i;j++)
1666  } // if (nnz_row_i==0) else
1667  } // for (unsigned i=0;i<n_rows;i++)
1668  } // End of sort_entries()
1669 
1670 //=============================================================================
1671 /// Clean method
1672 //=============================================================================
1673 void CRDoubleMatrix::clear()
1674 {
1675  this->clear_distribution();
1676  CR_matrix.clean_up_memory();
1677  Built = false;
1678 
1679  if(Linear_solver_pt != 0) // Only clean up if it exists
1680  Linear_solver_pt->clean_up_memory();
1681 }

1683 //=============================================================================
1684 /// \short build method: Takes the distribution and the number of columns, as
1685 /// well as the vector of values, vector of column indices,vector of row
1686 ///starts.
1687 //=============================================================================
1688 void CRDoubleMatrix::build(const LinearAlgebraDistribution* distribution_pt,
1689  const unsigned& ncol,
1690  const Vector<double>& value,
1691  const Vector<int>& column_index,
1692  const Vector<int>& row_start)
1693 {
1694  // clear
1695  this->clear();
1696 
1697  // store the Distribution
1698  this->build_distribution(distribution_pt);
1699 
1700  // set the linear solver
1701  Default_linear_solver_pt = new SuperLUSolver;
1702 
1703  // now build the matrix
1704  this->build(ncol,value,column_index,row_start);
1705 }

1708 /// \short method to rebuild the matrix, but not the distribution
1709 //=============================================================================
1710 void CRDoubleMatrix::build(const unsigned& ncol,
1711  const Vector<double>& value,
1712  const Vector<int>& column_index,
1713  const Vector<int>& row_start)
1714 {

1716  CR_matrix.clean_up_memory();
1717  CR_matrix.build(value,column_index,row_start,
1718  this->nrow_local(),ncol);
1719 
1720  // matrix has been build
1721  Built = true;
1722 }

1743 /// Do LU decomposition
1744 //=============================================================================
1745 void CRDoubleMatrix::ludecompose()
1746 {
1747 #ifdef PARANOID
1748  // check that the this matrix is built
1749  if (!Built)
1750  {
1751  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1752  error_message_stream
1753  << "This matrix has not been built.";
1754  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1755 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1756  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1757  }
1758 #endif
1759 
1760  // factorise using superlu or superlu dist if we oomph has mpi
1761  static_cast<SuperLUSolver*>(Default_linear_solver_pt)->factorise(this);
1762 
1763 }

1765 //=============================================================================
1766 /// Do back-substitution
1767 //=============================================================================
1768 void CRDoubleMatrix::lubksub(DoubleVector &rhs)
1769 {
1770 #ifdef PARANOID
1771  // check that the rhs vector is setup
1772  if (!rhs.built())
1773  {
1774  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1775  error_message_stream
1776  << "The vector rhs has not been setup";
1777  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1778 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1779  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1780  }
1781  // check that the rhs vector has the same distribution as this matrix
1782  if (!(*this->distribution_pt() == *rhs.distribution_pt()))
1783  {
1784  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1785  error_message_stream
1786  << "The vector rhs must have the same distribution as the matrix";
1787  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1788 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1789  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1790  }
1791 #endif
1792 
1793  // backsub
1794  DoubleVector rhs_copy(rhs);
1795  static_cast<SuperLUSolver*>(Default_linear_solver_pt)->backsub(rhs_copy,rhs);
1796 }

1798 //=============================================================================
1799 /// Multiply the matrix by the vector x
1800 //=============================================================================
1801 void CRDoubleMatrix::multiply(const DoubleVector &x, DoubleVector &soln) const
1802 {
1803 #ifdef PARANOID
1804  // check that this matrix is built
1805  if (!Built)
1806  {
1807  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1808  error_message_stream
1809  << "This matrix has not been built";
1810  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1811 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1812  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1813  }
1814  // check that the distribution of x is setup
1815  if (!x.built())
1816  {
1817  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1818  error_message_stream
1819  << "The distribution of the vector x must be setup";
1820  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1821 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1822  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1823  }
1824  // Check to see if x.size() = ncol().
1825  if (this->ncol() != x.distribution_pt()->nrow())
1826  {
1827  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1828  error_message_stream
1829  << "The number of rows in the x vector and the number of columns in the "
1830  << "matrix must be the same";
1831  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1832 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1833  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1834  }
1835  // if the soln is distributed
1836  if (soln.built())
1837  {
1838  if (!(*soln.distribution_pt() == *this->distribution_pt()))
1839  {
1840  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1841  error_message_stream
1842  << "The soln vector is setup and therefore must have the same "
1843  << "distribution as the matrix";
1844  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1845 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1846  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1847  }
1848  }
1849 #endif
1850 
1851  // if soln is not setup then setup the distribution
1852  if (!soln.built())
1853  {
1854  // Resize and initialize the solution vector
1855  soln.build(this->distribution_pt(),0.0);
1856  }
1857 
1858  // Initialise
1859  soln.initialise(0.0);
1860 
1861  // if distributed and on more than one processor use trilinos
1862  // otherwise use the oomph-lib methods
1863  if (this->distributed() &&
1864  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->nproc() > 1)
1865  {
1866 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS
1867  // This will only work if we have trilinos on board
1868  TrilinosEpetraHelpers::multiply(this,x,soln);
1869 #else
1870  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1871  error_message_stream
1872  << "Matrix-vector product on multiple processors with distributed "
1873  << "CRDoubleMatrix requires Trilinos.";
1874  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1875 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1876  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1877 #endif
1878  }
1879  else
1880  {
1881  unsigned n = this->nrow();
1882  const int* row_start = CR_matrix.row_start();
1883  const int* column_index = CR_matrix.column_index();
1884  const double* value = CR_matrix.value();
1885  double* soln_pt = soln.values_pt();
1886  const double* x_pt = x.values_pt();
1887  for (unsigned long i=0;i<n;i++)
1888  {
1889  soln_pt[i] = 0.0;
1890  for (long k=row_start[i];k<row_start[i+1];k++)
1891  {
1892  unsigned long j=column_index[k];
1893  double a_ij=value[k];
1894  soln_pt[i]+=a_ij*x_pt[j];
1895  }
1896  }
1897  }
1898 }
1899 
1900 //=================================================================
1901 /// Multiply the transposed matrix by the vector x: soln=A^T x
1902 //=================================================================
1903 void CRDoubleMatrix::multiply_transpose(const DoubleVector &x,
1904  DoubleVector &soln) const
1905 {
1906 #ifdef PARANOID
1907  // check that this matrix is built
1908  if (!Built)
1909  {
1910  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1911  error_message_stream
1912  << "This matrix has not been built";
1913  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1914 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1915  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1916  }
1917  // Check to see if x.size() = ncol().
1918  if (!(*this->distribution_pt() == *x.distribution_pt()))
1919  {
1920  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1921  error_message_stream
1922  << "The x vector and this matrix must have the same distribution.";
1923  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1924 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1925  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1926  }
1927  // if soln is setup then it should have the same distribution as x
1928  if (soln.built())
1929  {
1930  if (soln.distribution_pt()->nrow() != this->ncol())
1931  {
1932  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1933  error_message_stream
1934  << "The soln vector is setup and therefore must have the same "
1935  << "number of rows as the vector x";
1936  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1937 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1938  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1939  }
1940  }
1941 #endif
1942 
1943  // if soln is not setup then setup the distribution
1944  if (!soln.built())
1945  {
1946  LinearAlgebraDistribution* dist_pt =
1947  new LinearAlgebraDistribution(x.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt(),
1948  this->ncol(),this->distributed());
1949  soln.build(dist_pt,0.0);
1950  delete dist_pt;
1951  }
1952 
1953  // Initialise
1954  soln.initialise(0.0);
1955 
1956  if (this->distributed() &&
1957  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->nproc() > 1)
1958  {
1959 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS
1960  // This will only work if we have trilinos on board
1961  TrilinosEpetraHelpers::multiply(this,x,soln);
1962 #else
1963  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
1964  error_message_stream
1965  << "Matrix-vector product on multiple processors with distributed "
1966  << "CRDoubleMatrix requires Trilinos.";
1967  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
1968 OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1969  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1970 #endif
1971  }
1972  else
1973  {
1974  unsigned n = this->nrow();
1975  const int* row_start = CR_matrix.row_start();
1976  const int* column_index = CR_matrix.column_index();
1977  const double* value = CR_matrix.value();
1978  double* soln_pt = soln.values_pt();
1979  const double* x_pt = x.values_pt();
1980  // Matrix vector product
1981  for (unsigned long i=0;i<n;i++)
1982  {
1983  for (long k=row_start[i];k<row_start[i+1];k++)
1984  {
1985  unsigned long j=column_index[k];
1986  double a_ij=value[k];
1987  soln_pt[j]+=a_ij*x_pt[i];
1988  }
1989  }
1990  }
1991 }
1992 
1993 //===========================================================================
1994 /// Function to multiply this matrix by the CRDoubleMatrix matrix_in.
1995 /// In a serial matrix, there are 4 methods available:
1996 /// Method 1: First runs through this matrix and matrix_in to find the storage
1997 /// requirements for result - arrays of the correct size are
1998 /// then allocated before performing the calculation.
1999 /// Minimises memory requirements but more costly.
2000 /// Method 2: Grows storage for values and column indices of result 'on the
2001 /// fly' using an array of maps. Faster but more memory
2002 /// intensive.
2003 /// Method 3: Grows storage for values and column indices of result 'on the
2004 /// fly' using a vector of vectors. Not particularly impressive
2005 /// on the platforms we tried...
2006 /// Method 4: Trilinos Epetra Matrix Matrix multiply.
2007 /// Method 5: Trilinox Epetra Matrix Matrix Mulitply (ml based)
2008 /// If Trilinos is installed then Method 4 is employed by default, otherwise
2009 /// Method 2 is employed by default.
2010 /// In a distributed matrix, only Trilinos Epetra Matrix Matrix multiply
2011 /// is available.
2012 //=============================================================================
2013 void CRDoubleMatrix::multiply(const CRDoubleMatrix& matrix_in,
2014  CRDoubleMatrix& result) const
2015 {
2016 #ifdef PARANOID
2017  // check that this matrix is built
2018  if (!Built)
2019  {
2020  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
2021  error_message_stream
2022  << "This matrix has not been built";
2023  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
2024  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2025  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2026  }
2027  // check that this matrix is built
2028  if (!matrix_in.built())
2029  {
2030  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
2031  error_message_stream
2032  << "This matrix matrix_in has not been built";
2033  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
2034  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2035  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2036  }
2037  // if soln is setup then it should have the same distribution as x
2038  if (result.built())
2039  {
2040  if (!(*result.distribution_pt() == *this->distribution_pt()))
2041  {
2042  std::ostringstream error_message_stream;
2043  error_message_stream
2044  << "The matrix result is setup and therefore must have the same "
2045  << "distribution as the vector x";
2046  throw OomphLibError(error_message_stream.str(),
2047  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2048  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2049  }
2050  }
2051 #endif
2052 
2053  // if the result has not been setup, then store the distribution
2054  if (!result.distribution_built())
2055  {
2056  result.build(this->distribution_pt());
2057  }
2058 
2059  // short name for Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method
2060  unsigned method = Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method;
2061 
2062  // if this matrix is not distributed and matrix in is not distributed
2063  if (!this->distributed() && !matrix_in.distributed() &&
2064  ((method == 1) || (method == 2) || (method == 3)))
2065  {
2066  // NB N is number of rows!
2067  unsigned long N = this->nrow();
2068  unsigned long M = matrix_in.ncol();
2069  unsigned long Nnz = 0;
2070 
2071  // pointers to arrays which store result
2072  int* Row_start = 0;
2073  double* Value = 0;
2074  int* Column_index = 0;
2075 
2076  // get pointers to matrix_in
2077  const int* matrix_in_row_start = matrix_in.row_start();
2078  const int* matrix_in_column_index = matrix_in.column_index();
2079  const double* matrix_in_value = matrix_in.value();
2080 
2081  // get pointers to this matrix
2082  const double* this_value = this->value();
2083  const int* this_row_start = this->row_start();
2084  const int* this_column_index = this->column_index();
2085 
2086  //clock_t clock1 = clock();
2087 
2088  // METHOD 1
2089  // --------
2090  if (method==1)
2091  {
2092  // allocate storage for row starts
2093  Row_start = new int[N+1];
2094  Row_start[0]=0;
2095 
2096  // a set to store number of non-zero columns in each row of result
2097  std::set<unsigned> columns;
2098 
2099  // run through rows of this matrix and matrix_in to find number of
2100  // non-zero entries in each row of result
2101  for (unsigned long this_row = 0; this_row<N; this_row++)
2102  {
2103  // run through non-zeros in this_row of this matrix
2104  for (int this_ptr = this_row_start[this_row];
2105  this_ptr < this_row_start[this_row+1];
2106  this_ptr++)
2107  {
2108  // find column index for non-zero
2109  int matrix_in_row = this_column_index[this_ptr];
2110 
2111  // run through corresponding row in matrix_in
2112  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row];
2113  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row+1];
2114  matrix_in_ptr++)
2115  {
2116  // find column index for non-zero in matrix_in and store in columns
2117  columns.insert(matrix_in_column_index[matrix_in_ptr]);
2118  }
2119  }
2120  // update Row_start
2121  Row_start[this_row+1] = Row_start[this_row] + columns.size();
2122 
2123  // wipe values in columns
2124  columns.clear();
2125  }
2126 
2127  // set Nnz
2128  Nnz = Row_start[N];
2129 
2130  // allocate arrays for result
2131  Value = new double[Nnz];
2132  Column_index = new int[Nnz];
2133 
2134  // set all values of Column_index to -1
2135  for (unsigned long i=0; i<Nnz; i++)
2136  {
2137  Column_index[i] = -1;
2138  }
2139 
2140  // Calculate values for result - first run through rows of this matrix
2141  for (unsigned long this_row = 0; this_row<N; this_row++)
2142  {
2143  // run through non-zeros in this_row
2144  for (int this_ptr = this_row_start[this_row];
2145  this_ptr < this_row_start[this_row+1];
2146  this_ptr++)
2147  {
2148  // find value of non-zero
2149  double this_val = this_value[this_ptr];
2150 
2151  // find column associated with non-zero
2152  int matrix_in_row = this_column_index[this_ptr];
2153 
2154  // run through corresponding row in matrix_in
2155  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row];
2156  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row+1];
2157  matrix_in_ptr++)
2158  {
2159  // find column index for non-zero in matrix_in
2160  int col = matrix_in_column_index[matrix_in_ptr];
2161 
2162  // find position in result to insert value
2163  for(int ptr = Row_start[this_row];
2164  ptr <= Row_start[this_row+1];
2165  ptr++)
2166  {
2167  if (ptr == Row_start[this_row+1])
2168  {
2169  // error - have passed end of row without finding
2170  // correct column
2171  std::ostringstream error_message;
2172  error_message << "Error inserting value in result";
2173 
2174  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2175  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2176  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2177  }
2178  else if ( Column_index[ptr] == -1 )
2179  {
2180  // first entry for this column index
2181  Column_index[ptr] = col;
2182  Value[ptr] = this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
2183  break;
2184  }
2185  else if ( Column_index[ptr] == col )
2186  {
2187  // column index already exists - add value
2188  Value[ptr] += this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
2189  break;
2190  }
2191  }
2192  }
2193  }
2194  }
2195  }
2196 
2197  // METHOD 2
2198  // --------
2199  else if (method==2)
2200  {
2201  // generate array of maps to store values for result
2202  std::map<int,double>* result_maps = new std::map<int,double>[N];
2203 
2204  // run through rows of this matrix
2205  for (unsigned long this_row = 0; this_row<N; this_row++)
2206  {
2207  // run through non-zeros in this_row
2208  for (int this_ptr = this_row_start[this_row];
2209  this_ptr < this_row_start[this_row+1];
2210  this_ptr++)
2211  {
2212  // find value of non-zero
2213  double this_val = this_value[this_ptr];
2214 
2215  // find column index associated with non-zero
2216  int matrix_in_row = this_column_index[this_ptr];
2217 
2218  // run through corresponding row in matrix_in
2219  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row];
2220  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row+1];
2221  matrix_in_ptr++)
2222  {
2223  // find column index for non-zero in matrix_in
2224  int col = matrix_in_column_index[matrix_in_ptr];
2225 
2226  // insert value
2227  result_maps[this_row][col] += this_val * matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
2228  }
2229  }
2230  }
2231 
2232  // allocate Row_start
2233  Row_start = new int[N+1];
2234 
2235  // copy across row starts
2236  Row_start[0] = 0;
2237  for (unsigned long row=0; row<N; row++)
2238  {
2239  int size = result_maps[row].size();
2240  Row_start[row+1] = Row_start[row] + size;
2241  }
2242 
2243  // set Nnz
2244  Nnz = Row_start[N];
2245 
2246  // allocate other arrays
2247  Value = new double[Nnz];
2248  Column_index = new int[Nnz];
2249 
2250  // copy values and column indices
2251  for (unsigned long row=0; row<N; row++)
2252  {
2253  unsigned ptr = Row_start[row];
2254  for (std::map<int,double>::iterator i = result_maps[row].begin();
2255  i != result_maps[row].end();
2256  i ++)
2257  {
2258  Column_index[ptr]= i->first;
2259  Value[ptr] = i->second;
2260  ptr++;
2261  }
2262  }
2263 
2264  // tidy up memory
2265  delete[] result_maps;
2266  }
2267 
2268  // METHOD 3
2269  // --------
2270  else if (method==3)
2271  {
2272  // vectors of vectors to store results
2273  std::vector< std::vector<int> > result_cols(N);
2274  std::vector< std::vector<double> > result_vals(N);
2275 
2276  // run through the rows of this matrix
2277  for (unsigned long this_row = 0; this_row<N; this_row++)
2278  {
2279  // run through non-zeros in this_row
2280  for (int this_ptr = this_row_start[this_row];
2281  this_ptr < this_row_start[this_row+1];
2282  this_ptr++)
2283  {
2284  // find value of non-zero
2285  double this_val = this_value[this_ptr];
2286 
2287  // find column index associated with non-zero
2288  int matrix_in_row = this_column_index[this_ptr];
2289 
2290  // run through corresponding row in matrix_in
2291  for (int matrix_in_ptr = matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row];
2292  matrix_in_ptr < matrix_in_row_start[matrix_in_row+1];
2293  matrix_in_ptr++)
2294  {
2295  // find column index for non-zero in matrix_in
2296  int col = matrix_in_column_index[matrix_in_ptr];
2297 
2298  // insert value
2299  int size = result_cols[this_row].size();
2300  for (int i = 0; i<=size; i++)
2301  {
2302  if (i==size)
2303  {
2304  // first entry for this column
2305  result_cols[this_row].push_back(col);
2306  result_vals[this_row].push_back(
2307  this_val*matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr]);
2308  }
2309  else if (col==result_cols[this_row][i])
2310  {
2311  // column already exists
2312  result_vals[this_row][i] += this_val *
2313  matrix_in_value[matrix_in_ptr];
2314  break;
2315  }
2316  }
2317  }
2318  }
2319  }
2320 
2321  // allocate Row_start
2322  Row_start = new int[N+1];
2323 
2324  // copy across row starts
2325  Row_start[0] = 0;
2326  for (unsigned long row=0; row<N; row++)
2327  {
2328  int size = result_cols[row].size();
2329  Row_start[row+1] = Row_start[row] + size;
2330  }
2331 
2332  // set Nnz
2333  Nnz = Row_start[N];
2334 
2335  // allocate other arrays
2336  Value = new double[Nnz];
2337  Column_index = new int[Nnz];
2338 
2339  // copy across values and column indices
2340  for (unsigned long row=0; row<N; row++)
2341  {
2342  unsigned ptr = Row_start[row];
2343  unsigned nnn=result_cols[row].size();
2344  for (unsigned i = 0; i < nnn; i++)
2345  {
2346  Column_index[ptr] = result_cols[row][i];
2347  Value[ptr] = result_vals[row][i];
2348  ptr++;
2349  }
2350  }
2351  }
2352 
2353  // build
2354  result.build_without_copy(M, Nnz, Value, Column_index, Row_start);
2355  }
2356 
2357  // else we have to use trilinos
2358  else
2359  {
2360 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_TRILINOS
2361  bool use_ml = false;
2362  if (method == 5)
2363  {
2364  use_ml = true;
2365  }
2366  TrilinosEpetraHelpers::multiply(*this,matrix_in,result,use_ml);
2367 #else
2368  std::ostringstream error_message;
2369  error_message << "Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method = "
2370  << Serial_matrix_matrix_multiply_method
2371  << " requires trilinos.";
2372  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2373  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2374  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2375 #endif
2376  }
2377 }
2378 
2379 
2380 
2381 //=================================================================
2382 /// For every row, find the maximum absolute value of the
2383 /// entries in this row. Set all values that are less than alpha times
2384 /// this maximum to zero and return the resulting matrix in
2385 /// reduced_matrix. Note: Diagonal entries are retained regardless
2386 /// of their size.
2387 //=================================================================
2388 void CRDoubleMatrix::matrix_reduction(const double &alpha,
2389  CRDoubleMatrix &reduced_matrix)
2390 {
2391  // number of rows in matrix
2392  long n_row=nrow_local();
2393  double max_row;
2394 
2395  // Here's the packed format for the new matrix
2396  Vector<int> B_row_start(1);
2397  Vector<int> B_column_index;
2398  Vector<double> B_value;
2399 
2400  // get pointers to the underlying data
2401  const int* row_start = CR_matrix.row_start();
2402  const int* column_index = CR_matrix.column_index();
2403  const double* value = CR_matrix.value();
2404 
2405  // k is counter for the number of entries in the reduced matrix
2406  unsigned k=0;
2407 
2408  // Initialise row start
2409  B_row_start[0]=0;
2410 
2411  // Loop over rows
2412  for(long i=0;i<n_row;i++)
2413  {
2414  // Initialise max value in row
2415  max_row=0.0;
2416 
2417  //Loop over entries in columns
2418  for(long j=row_start[i];j<row_start[i+1];j++)
2419  {
2420  // Find max. value in row
2421  if(std::fabs(value[j])>max_row)
2422  {
2423  max_row=std::fabs(value[j]);
2424  }
2425  }
2426 
2427  // Decide if we need to retain the entries in the row
2428  for(long j=row_start[i];j<row_start[i+1];j++)
2429  {
2430  // If we're on the diagonal or the value is sufficiently large: retain
2431  // i.e. copy across.
2432  if(i==column_index[j] || std::fabs(value[j])>alpha*max_row )
2433  {
2434  B_value.push_back(value[j]);
2435  B_column_index.push_back(column_index[j]);
2436  k++;
2437  }
2438  }
2439  // This writes the row start for the next row -- equal to
2440  // to the number of entries written so far (C++ zero-based indexing!)
2441  B_row_start.push_back(k);
2442  }
2443 
2444  // Build the matrix from the compressed format
2445  dynamic_cast<CRDoubleMatrix&>(reduced_matrix).
2446  build(this->ncol(),B_value,B_column_index,B_row_start);
2447  }
2448 
2449 //=============================================================================
2450 /// if this matrix is distributed then the equivalent global matrix is built
2451 /// using new and returned. The calling method is responsible for the
2452 /// destruction of the new matrix.
2453 //=============================================================================
2454 CRDoubleMatrix* CRDoubleMatrix::global_matrix() const
2455 {
2456 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
2457  // if this matrix is not distributed then this method is redundant
2458  if (!this->distributed() ||
2459  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->nproc() == 1)
2460  {
2461  return new CRDoubleMatrix(*this);
2462  }
2463 
2464  // nnz
2465  int nnz = this->nnz();
2466 
2467  // my nrow local
2468  unsigned nrow_local = this->nrow_local();
2469 
2470  // nrow global
2471  unsigned nrow = this->nrow();
2472 
2473  // cache nproc
2474  int nproc = this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->nproc();
2475 
2476  // get the nnzs on the other processors
2477  int* dist_nnz_pt = new int[nproc];
2478  MPI_Allgather(&nnz,1,MPI_INT,
2479  dist_nnz_pt,1,MPI_INT,
2480  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->mpi_comm());
2481 
2482  // create a int vector of first rows and nrow local and compute nnz global
2483  int* dist_first_row = new int[nproc];
2484  int* dist_nrow_local = new int[nproc];
2485  int nnz_global = 0;
2486  for (int p = 0; p < nproc; p++)
2487  {
2488  nnz_global += dist_nnz_pt[p];
2489  dist_first_row[p] = this->first_row(p);
2490  dist_nrow_local[p] = this->nrow_local(p);
2491  }
2492 
2493  // compute the offset for the values and column index data
2494  int* nnz_offset = new int[nproc];
2495  nnz_offset[0] = 0;
2496  for (int p = 1; p < nproc; p++)
2497  {
2498  nnz_offset[p] = nnz_offset[p-1] + dist_nnz_pt[p-1];
2499  }
2500 
2501  // get pointers to the (current) distributed data
2502  // const_cast required because MPI requires non-const data when sending
2503  // data
2504  int* dist_row_start = const_cast<int*>(this->row_start());
2505  int* dist_column_index = const_cast<int*>(this->column_index());
2506  double* dist_value = const_cast<double*>(this->value());
2507 
2508  // space for the global matrix
2509  int* global_row_start = new int[nrow+1];
2510  int* global_column_index = new int[nnz_global];
2511  double* global_value = new double[nnz_global];
2512 
2513  // get the row starts
2514  MPI_Allgatherv(dist_row_start,nrow_local,MPI_INT,
2515  global_row_start,dist_nrow_local,dist_first_row,MPI_INT,
2516  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->mpi_comm());
2517 
2518  // get the column indexes
2519  MPI_Allgatherv(dist_column_index,nnz,MPI_INT,
2520  global_column_index,dist_nnz_pt,nnz_offset,MPI_INT,
2521  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->mpi_comm());
2522 
2523  // get the values
2524  MPI_Allgatherv(dist_value,nnz,MPI_DOUBLE,
2525  global_value,dist_nnz_pt,nnz_offset,MPI_DOUBLE,
2526  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->mpi_comm());
2527 
2528  // finally the last row start
2529  global_row_start[nrow] = nnz_global;
2530 
2531  // update the other row start
2532  for (int p = 0; p < nproc; p++)
2533  {
2534  for (int i = 0; i < dist_nrow_local[p]; i++)
2535  {
2536  unsigned j = dist_first_row[p] + i;
2537  global_row_start[j]+=nnz_offset[p];
2538  }
2539  }
2540 
2541  // create the global distribution
2542  LinearAlgebraDistribution* dist_pt = new
2543  LinearAlgebraDistribution(this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt(),nrow,false);
2544 
2545  // create the matrix
2546  CRDoubleMatrix* matrix_pt = new CRDoubleMatrix(dist_pt);
2547 
2548  // copy of distribution taken so delete
2549  delete dist_pt;
2550 
2551  // pass data into matrix
2552  matrix_pt->build_without_copy(this->ncol(),nnz_global,global_value,
2553  global_column_index,global_row_start);
2554 
2555  // clean up
2556  delete[] dist_first_row;
2557  delete[] dist_nrow_local;
2558  delete[] nnz_offset;
2559  delete[] dist_nnz_pt;
2560 
2561  // and return
2562  return matrix_pt;
2563 #else
2564  return new CRDoubleMatrix(*this);
2565 #endif
2566 }
2567 
2568  //============================================================================
2569  /// The contents of the matrix are redistributed to match the new
2570  /// distribution. In a non-MPI build this method does nothing.
2571  /// \b NOTE 1: The current distribution and the new distribution must have
2572  /// the same number of global rows.
2573  /// \b NOTE 2: The current distribution and the new distribution must have
2574  /// the same Communicator.
2575  //============================================================================
2576  void CRDoubleMatrix::redistribute(const LinearAlgebraDistribution*
2577  const& dist_pt)
2578  {
2579 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
2580 #ifdef PARANOID
2581  // paranoid check that the nrows for both distributions is the
2582  // same
2583  if (dist_pt->nrow() != this->distribution_pt()->nrow())
2584  {
2585  std::ostringstream error_message;
2586  error_message << "The number of global rows in the new distribution ("
2587  << dist_pt->nrow() << ") is not equal to the number"
2588  << " of global rows in the current distribution ("
2589  << this->distribution_pt()->nrow() << ").\n";
2590  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2591  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2592  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2593  }
2594  // paranoid check that the current distribution and the new distribution
2595  // have the same Communicator
2596  OomphCommunicator temp_comm(*dist_pt->communicator_pt());
2597  if (!(temp_comm == *this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()))
2598  {
2599  std::ostringstream error_message;
2600  error_message << "The new distribution and the current distribution must "
2601  << "have the same communicator.";
2602  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2603  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2604  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2605  }
2606  // paranoid check that the matrix is build
2607  if (!this->built())
2608  {
2609  std::ostringstream error_message;
2610  error_message << "The matrix must be build to be redistributed";
2611  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2612  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2613  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2614  }
2615 #endif
2616 
2617  // if the two distributions are not the same
2618  // =========================================
2619  if (!((*this->distribution_pt()) == *dist_pt))
2620  {
2621  // Get the number of columns to build the matrix.
2622  unsigned long ncol = this->ncol();
2623 
2624  // current data
2625  int* current_row_start = this->row_start();
2626  int* current_column_index = this->column_index();
2627  double* current_value = this->value();

2630  int my_rank = this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->my_rank();
2631  int nproc = this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->nproc();
