2633  // if both distributions are distributed
2634  // =====================================
2635  if (this->distributed() && dist_pt->distributed())
2636  {

2639  Vector<unsigned> new_first_row(nproc);
2640  Vector<unsigned> new_nrow_local(nproc);
2641  Vector<unsigned> current_first_row(nproc);
2642  Vector<unsigned> current_nrow_local(nproc);
2643  for (int i = 0; i < nproc; i++)
2644  {
2645  new_first_row[i] = dist_pt->first_row(i);
2646  new_nrow_local[i] = dist_pt->nrow_local(i);
2647  current_first_row[i] = this->first_row(i);
2648  current_nrow_local[i] = this->nrow_local(i);
2649  }
2650 
2651  // compute which local rows are expected to be received from each

2654  Vector<unsigned> nrow_local_for_proc(nproc,0);
2655  Vector<unsigned> first_row_from_proc(nproc,0);

2659  // will sent and received by this processor
2660  for (int p = 0; p < nproc; p++)
2661  {
2662  // start with data to be sent
2663  if ((new_first_row[p] < (current_first_row[my_rank] +
2664  current_nrow_local[my_rank])) &&
2665  (current_first_row[my_rank] < (new_first_row[p] +
2666  new_nrow_local[p])))
2667  {
2668  first_row_for_proc[p] =
2669  std::max(current_first_row[my_rank],
2670  new_first_row[p]);
2671  nrow_local_for_proc[p] =
2672  std::min((current_first_row[my_rank] +
2673  current_nrow_local[my_rank]),
2674  (new_first_row[p] +
2675  new_nrow_local[p])) - first_row_for_proc[p];
2676  }
2677

2679  if ((new_first_row[my_rank] < (current_first_row[p] +
2680  current_nrow_local[p]))
2681  && (current_first_row[p] < (new_first_row[my_rank] +
2682  new_nrow_local[my_rank])))
2683  {
2684  first_row_from_proc[p] =
2685  std::max(current_first_row[p],
2686  new_first_row[my_rank]);
2687  nrow_local_from_proc[p] =
2688  std::min((current_first_row[p] +
2689  current_nrow_local[p]),
2690  (new_first_row[my_rank] +
2691  new_nrow_local[my_rank]))-first_row_from_proc[p];
2692  }
2693  }

2696  Vector<unsigned> nnz_for_proc(nproc,0);
2697  for (int p = 0; p < nproc; p++)

2700  {

2703  nrow_local_for_proc[p]]-
2704  current_row_start[first_row_for_proc[p]-

2706  }

2710  Vector<unsigned> nnz_from_proc(nproc,0);
2711  Vector<MPI_Request> send_req;
2712  Vector<MPI_Request> nnz_recv_req;
2713  for (int p = 0; p < nproc; p++)
2714  {

2716  {
2717  // send
2718  if (nrow_local_for_proc[p] > 0)

2720  MPI_Request req;
2721  MPI_Isend(&nnz_for_proc[p],1,MPI_UNSIGNED,p,0,
2722  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->mpi_comm(),&req);
2723  send_req.push_back(req);
2724  }

2729  MPI_Request req;
2730  MPI_Irecv(&nnz_from_proc[p],1,MPI_UNSIGNED,p,0,

2732  nnz_recv_req.push_back(req);
2733  }
2734  }

2739  }

2744

2746  unsigned n_recv_req = nnz_recv_req.size();
2747  if (n_recv_req > 0)

2750  MPI_Waitall(n_recv_req,&nnz_recv_req[0],&recv_status[0]);
2751  }

2799  offsets[0] -= base_address;

3218  int* dist_row_start = new int[nrow_local+1];
3219  int* dist_column_index = new int[nnz];
3220  double* dist_value = new double[nnz];
3221 
3222  // copy
3223  int offset = global_row_start[first_row];
3224  for (unsigned i = 0; i <= nrow_local; i++)
3225  {
3226  dist_row_start[i] = global_row_start[first_row+i]-offset;
3227  }
3228  for (unsigned i = 0; i < nnz; i++)
3229  {
3230  dist_column_index[i] = global_column_index[offset+i];
3231  dist_value[i] = global_value[offset+i];
3232  }
3233 
3234  // rebuild
3235  this->build(dist_pt);
3236  this->build_without_copy(ncol,nnz,dist_value,
3237  dist_column_index,dist_row_start);
3238  }
3239  }
3240 #endif
3241  }
3242 
3243 //=============================================================================
3244 /// Compute transpose of matrix
3245 //=============================================================================
3246  void CRDoubleMatrix::get_matrix_transpose(CRDoubleMatrix* result) const
3247  {
3248  // Get the number of non_zeros
3249  unsigned long nnon_zeros=this->nnz();
3250 
3251  // Find the number of rows and columns in the transposed
3252  // matrix. We differentiate these from those associated
3253  // with the original matrix by appending the characters
3254  // '_t' onto the end
3255  unsigned long n_rows=this->nrow();
3256  unsigned long n_rows_t=this->ncol();
3257 
3258 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
3259  // We only need to produce a warning if the matrix is distributed
3260  if (this->distributed())
3261  {
3262  // Create an ostringstream object to store the warning message
3263  std::ostringstream warning_message;
3264 
3265  // Create the warning messsage
3266  warning_message << "This method currently works for serial but "
3267  << "has not been tested with MPI!\n";
3268 
3269  // Issue the warning
3270  OomphLibWarning(warning_message.str(),
3271  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3272  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3273  }
3274 #endif
3275 
3276  // Set up the distribution for the transposed matrix
3277  result->distribution_pt()->build(this->distribution_pt()->
3278  communicator_pt(),n_rows_t,false);
3279 
3280  // Acquire access to the value, row_start and column_index
3281  // arrays from the CR matrix
3282  const double* value_pt=this->value();
3283  const int* row_start_pt=this->row_start();
3284  const int* column_index_pt=this->column_index();
3285 
3286  // Allocate space for the row_start and column_index vectors
3287  // associated with the transpose of the current matrix.
3288  Vector<double> value_t(nnon_zeros,0.0);
3289  Vector<int> column_index_t(nnon_zeros,0);
3290  Vector<int> row_start_t(n_rows_t+1,0);
3291 
3292  // Loop over the column index vector and count how many times
3293  // each column number occurs and increment the appropriate
3294  // entry in row_start_t whose i+1'th entry will contain the
3295  // number of non-zeros in the i'th column of the matrix (this
3296  // is done so that the cumulative sum done next returns the
3297  // correct result)
3298  for (unsigned i=0;i<nnon_zeros;i++)
3299  {
3300  // Assign entries to row_start_t (noting the first
3301  // entry is left as 0 for the cumulative sum done later)
3302  row_start_t[*(column_index_pt+i)+1]++;
3303  }
3304 
3305  // Calculate the sum of the first i entries in the row_start_t
3306  // vector and store the values in the i'th entry of row_start_t
3307  for (unsigned i=1;i<n_rows_t+1;i++)
3308  {
3309  // Calculate the cumulative sum
3310  row_start_t[i]+=row_start_t[i-1];
3311  }
3312 
3313  // Allocate space for variables to store the indices of the
3314  // start and end of the non-zeros in a given row of the matrix
3315  unsigned i_row_s=0;
3316  unsigned i_row_e=0;
3317 
3318  // Initialise 3 extra variables for readability of the
3319  // code in the subsequent piece of code
3320  unsigned a=0;
3321  unsigned b=0;
3322  unsigned c=0;
3323 
3324  // Vector needed to count the number of entries added
3325  // to each segment in column_index_t where each segment
3326  // is associated with each row in the transposed matrix
3327  Vector<int> counter(n_rows_t,0);
3328 
3329  // Set the entries in column_index_t. To do this we loop
3330  // over each row of the original matrix (equivalently
3331  // the number of columns in the transpose)
3332  for (unsigned i_row=0;i_row<n_rows;i_row++)
3333  {
3334  // Here we find the indices of the start and end
3335  // of the non-zeros in i_row'th row of the matrix.
3336  // [Note, there should be a -1 on i_row_e but this
3337  // is ignored so that we use a strict inequality
3338  // in the subsequent for-loop!]
3339  i_row_s=*(row_start_pt+i_row);
3340  i_row_e=*(row_start_pt+i_row+1);
3341 
3342  // Loop over the entries in the i_row'th row
3343  // of the matrix
3344  for (unsigned j=i_row_s;j<i_row_e;j++)
3345  {
3346 
3347  // The value of a is the column index of the j'th
3348  // element in the i_row'th row of the original matrix
3349  // (which is also the row index of the associated
3350  // non-zero in the transposed matrix)
3351  a=*(column_index_pt+j);
3352 
3353  // The value of b will be used to find the start
3354  // of the appropriate segment of column_index_t
3355  // that the non-zero belongs in
3356  b=row_start_t[a];
3357 
3358  // Find the number of elements already added to
3359  // this segment (to find which entry of the segment
3360  // the value i_row, the column index of the non-zero
3361  // in the transposed matrix, should be assigned to)
3362  c=counter[*(column_index_pt+j)];
3363 
3364  // Assign the value i_row to the appropriate entry
3365  // in column_index_t
3366  column_index_t[b+c]=i_row;
3367  value_t[b+c]=*(value_pt+j);
3368 
3369  // Increment the j'th value of the vector counter
3370  // to indicate another non-zero index has been
3371  // added into the
3372  counter[*(column_index_pt+j)]++;
3373 
3374  } // End of for-loop over i_row'th row of the matrix
3375 
3376  } // End of for-loop over rows of the matrix
3377 
3378  // Build the matrix (note: the value of n_cols for the
3379  // transposed matrix is n_rows for the original matrix)
3380  result->build(n_rows,value_t,column_index_t,row_start_t);
3381 
3382  } // End of the function
3383 
3384 
3385 //=============================================================================
3386 /// Compute infinity (maximum) norm of matrix
3387 //=============================================================================
3388 double CRDoubleMatrix::inf_norm() const
3389  {
3390 #ifdef PARANOID
3391  // paranoid check that the vector is setup
3392  if (!this->distribution_built())
3393  {
3394  std::ostringstream error_message;
3395  error_message << "This matrix must be setup.";
3396  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3397  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3398  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3399  }
3400 #endif
3401 
3402  // compute the local norm
3403  unsigned nrow_local = this->nrow_local();
3404  double n = 0;
3405  const int* row_start = CR_matrix.row_start();
3406  const double* value = CR_matrix.value();
3407  for (unsigned i = 0; i < nrow_local; i++)
3408  {
3409  double a = 0;
3410  for (int j = row_start[i]; j < row_start[i+1]; j++)
3411  {
3412  a += fabs(value[j]);
3413  }
3414  n = std::max(n,a);
3415  }
3416 
3417  // if this vector is distributed and on multiple processors then gather
3418 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
3419  double n2 = n;
3420  if ( this->distributed() &&
3421  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->nproc() > 1)
3422  {
3423  MPI_Allreduce(&n,&n2,1,MPI_DOUBLE,MPI_MAX,
3424  this->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt()->mpi_comm());
3425  }
3426  n = n2;
3427 #endif
3428 
3429  // and return
3430  return n;
3431  }
3432 
3433 //=============================================================================
3434 /// Return the diagonal entries of the matrix.
3435 /// This only works with square matrices. This condition may be relaxed
3436 /// in the future if need be.
3437 //=============================================================================
3438 Vector<double> CRDoubleMatrix::diagonal_entries() const
3439 {
3440 
3441 #ifdef PARANOID
3442  // Check if the matrix has been built.
3443  if(!this->built())
3444  {
3445  std::ostringstream error_message;
3446  error_message << "The matrix has not been built.\n"
3447  << "Please build it...\n";
3448  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3449  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3450  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3451  }
3452 
3453  // Check if this is a square matrix.
3454  if(this->nrow() != this->ncol())
3455  {
3456  std::ostringstream error_message;
3457  error_message << "The matrix is not square. Can only get the diagonal\n"
3458  << "entries of a square matrix.\n";
3459  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3460  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3461  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3462  }
3463 #endif
3464 
3465  // We get the diagonal entries on this processor.
3466  unsigned nrow_local = this->nrow_local();
3467 
3468  // Create storage for the diagonal entries.
3469  Vector<double> result_vec;
3470  result_vec.reserve(nrow_local);
3471 
3472  // Get the first row for the column offset.
3473  unsigned first_row = this->first_row();
3474 
3475  // Loop through the local rows.
3476  for (unsigned i = 0; i < nrow_local; i++)
3477  {
3478  // The column entries are globally indexed.
3479  unsigned diag_entry_col = first_row + i;
3480 
3481  // Push back the diagonal entry.
3482  result_vec.push_back(CR_matrix.get_entry(i, diag_entry_col));
3483  }
3484 
3485  return result_vec;
3486 }

3488 //=============================================================================
3489 /// Element-wise addition of this matrix with matrix_in.
3490 //=============================================================================
3491 void CRDoubleMatrix::add(const CRDoubleMatrix &matrix_in,
3492  CRDoubleMatrix &result_matrix) const
3493 {
3494 #ifdef PARANOID
3495  // Check if this matrix is built.
3496  if(!this->built())
3497  {
3498  std::ostringstream error_message;
3499  error_message << "The matrix is not built.\n"
3500  << "Please build the matrix!\n";
3501  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3502  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3503  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3504  }
3505 
3506  // Check if this matrix_in is built.
3507  if(!matrix_in.built())
3508  {
3509  std::ostringstream error_message;
3510  error_message << "The matrix matrix_in is not built.\n"
3511  << "Please build the matrix!\n";
3512  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3513  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3514  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3515  }
3516 
3517  // Check if the dimensions of this matrix and matrix_in are the same.
3518  unsigned long this_nrow = this->nrow();
3519  unsigned long matrix_in_nrow = matrix_in.nrow();
3520  if(this_nrow != matrix_in_nrow)
3521  {
3522  std::ostringstream error_message;
3523  error_message << "matrix_in has a different number of rows than\n"
3524  << "this matrix.\n";
3525  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3526  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3527  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3528  }
3529 
3530  unsigned long this_ncol = this->ncol();
3531  unsigned long matrix_in_ncol = matrix_in.ncol();
3532  if(this_ncol != matrix_in_ncol)
3533  {
3534  std::ostringstream error_message;
3535  error_message << "matrix_in has a different number of columns than\n"
3536  << "this matrix.\n";
3537  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3538  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3539  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3540  }
3541 
3542  // Check if the distribution is the same (Otherwise we may have to send and
3543  // receive data from other processors - which is not implemented!)
3544  if(*(this->distribution_pt()) != *(matrix_in.distribution_pt()))
3545  {
3546  std::ostringstream error_message;
3547  error_message << "matrix_in must have the same distribution as\n"
3548  << "this matrix.\n";
3549  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3550  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3551  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3552  }
3553 
3554  // If the matrix is built, check that it's existing distribution is the
3555  // same as the in matrix. Since we'll use the same distribution instead
3556  // of completely rebuilding it.
3557  if(result_matrix.built() &&
3558  (*result_matrix.distribution_pt() != *matrix_in.distribution_pt()))
3559  {
3560  std::ostringstream error_message;
3561  error_message << "The result_matrix is built. "
3562  << "But has a different distribution from matrix_in \n"
3563  << "They need to be the same.\n";
3564  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3565  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3566  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3567  }
3568 #endif
3569 
3570  // To add the elements of two CRDoubleMatrices, we need to know the union of
3571  // the sparsity patterns. This is determined by the column indices.
3572  // We add the column indices and values (entries) as a key-value pair in
3573  // a map (per row). We then read these out into two column indices and values
3574  // vector for the result matrix.
3575 
3576  unsigned nrow_local = this->nrow_local();
3577  Vector<int> res_column_indices;
3578  Vector<double> res_values;
3579  Vector<int> res_row_start;
3580  res_row_start.reserve(nrow_local+1);
3581 
3582  // The row_start and column_indices
3583  const int* this_column_indices = this->column_index();
3584  const int* this_row_start = this->row_start();
3585  const int* in_column_indices = matrix_in.column_index();
3586  const int* in_row_start = matrix_in.row_start();
3587 
3588  // Values from this matrix and matrix_in.
3589  const double* this_values = this->value();
3590  const double* in_values = matrix_in.value();
3591 
3592 
3593  // The first entry in row_start is always zero.
3594  res_row_start.push_back(0);
3595 
3596  // Loop through the rows of both matrices and insert the column indices and
3597  // values as a key-value pair.
3598  for (unsigned row_i = 0; row_i < nrow_local; row_i++)
3599  {
3600  // Create the map for this row.
3601  std::map<int,double> res_row_map;
3602 
3603  // Insert the column and value pair for this matrix.
3604  for (int i = this_row_start[row_i]; i < this_row_start[row_i+1]; i++)
3605  {
3606  res_row_map[this_column_indices[i]] = this_values[i];
3607  }
3608 
3609  // Insert the column and value pair for in matrix.
3610  for (int i = in_row_start[row_i]; i < in_row_start[row_i+1]; i++)
3611  {
3612  res_row_map[in_column_indices[i]] += in_values[i];
3613  }
3614 
3615  // Fill in the row start
3616  res_row_start.push_back(res_row_start.back() + res_row_map.size());
3617 
3618  // Now insert the key into res_column_indices and value into res_values
3619  for(std::map<int,double>::iterator it = res_row_map.begin();
3620  it != res_row_map.end(); ++it)
3621  {
3622  res_column_indices.push_back(it->first);
3623  res_values.push_back(it->second);
3624  }
3625  }
3626 
3627  // Finally build the result_matrix.
3628  if(result_matrix.distribution_pt()->built())
3629  {
3630  // Use the existing distribution.
3631  result_matrix.build(this->ncol(),res_values,
3632  res_column_indices,res_row_start);
3633  }
3634  else
3635  {
3636  // Build with THIS distribution
3637  result_matrix.build(this->distribution_pt(),this->ncol(),res_values,
3638  res_column_indices,res_row_start);
3639  }
3640 }
3641 
3642 //=================================================================
3643 /// Namespace for helper functions for CRDoubleMatrices
3644 //=================================================================
3645 namespace CRDoubleMatrixHelpers
3646 {
3647  //============================================================================
3648  /// \short Builds a uniformly distributed matrix.
3649  /// A locally replicated matrix is constructed then redistributed using
3650  /// OOMPH-LIB's default uniform row distribution.
3651  /// This is memory intensive thus should be used for
3652  /// testing or small problems only.
3653  //============================================================================
3654  void create_uniformly_distributed_matrix(
3655  const unsigned &nrow, const unsigned &ncol,
3656  const OomphCommunicator* const comm_pt,
3657  const Vector<double> &values,
3658  const Vector<int> &column_indices, const Vector<int> &row_start,
3659  CRDoubleMatrix &matrix_out)
3660  {
3661 #ifdef PARANOID
3662  // Check if the communicator exists.
3663  if(comm_pt == 0)
3664  {
3665  std::ostringstream error_message;
3666  error_message << "Please supply the communicator.\n";
3667  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3668  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3669  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3670  }
3671  // Is the out matrix built? We need an empty matrix!
3672  if(matrix_out.built())
3673  {
3674  std::ostringstream error_message;
3675  error_message << "The result matrix has been built.\n"
3676  << "Please clear the matrix.\n";
3677  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3678  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3679  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3680  }
3681 #endif
3682 
3683  // Create the locally replicated distribution.
3684  bool distributed = false;
3685  LinearAlgebraDistribution
3686  locally_replicated_distribution(comm_pt,nrow,distributed);
3687 
3688  // Create the matrix.
3689  matrix_out.build(&locally_replicated_distribution,ncol,
3690  values,column_indices,row_start);
3691 
3692  // Create the distributed distribution.
3693  distributed = true;
3694  LinearAlgebraDistribution
3695  distributed_distribution(comm_pt,nrow,distributed);
3696 
3697  // Redistribute the matrix.
3698  matrix_out.redistribute(&distributed_distribution);
3699  }
3700 
3701  //============================================================================
3702  /// Compute infinity (maximum) norm of sub blocks as if it was one matrix
3703  //============================================================================
3704  double inf_norm(const DenseMatrix<CRDoubleMatrix*> &matrix_pt)
3705  {
3706 
3707  // The number of block rows and columns
3708  const unsigned nblockrow = matrix_pt.nrow();
3709  const unsigned nblockcol = matrix_pt.ncol();
3710 
3711 #ifdef PARANOID
3712  // Check that tehre is at least one matrix.
3713  if(matrix_pt.nrow() == 0)
3714  {
3715  std::ostringstream error_message;
3716  error_message << "There are no matrices... \n";
3717  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3718  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3719  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3720  }
3721 
3722 
3723  // Check that all matrix_pt pointers are not null
3724  // and the matrices are built.
3725  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3726  {
3727  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3728  {
3729  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) == 0)
3730  {
3731  std::ostringstream error_message;
3732  error_message << "The pointer martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
3733  << "," << block_col_i <<") is null.\n";
3734  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3735  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3736  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3737  }
3738 
3739  if(!matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->built())
3740  {
3741  std::ostringstream error_message;
3742  error_message << "The matrix at martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
3743  << "," << block_col_i <<") is not built.\n";
3744  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3745  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3746  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3747  }
3748  }
3749  }
3750 #endif
3751 
3752 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
3753 
3754  // The communicator pointer from block (0,0)
3755  const OomphCommunicator* const comm_pt
3756  = matrix_pt(0,0)->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt();
3757 
3758 #ifdef PARANOID
3759 
3760 
3761  // Check that all communicators are the same
3762  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3763  {
3764  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3765  {
3766  // Communicator for this block matrix.
3767  const OomphCommunicator current_block_comm
3768  = *(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)
3769  ->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt());
3770  if(*comm_pt != current_block_comm)
3771  {
3772  std::ostringstream error_message;
3773  error_message << "The communicator of block martrix_pt("<< block_row_i
3774  << "," << block_col_i <<") is not the same as block "
3775  << "matrix_pt(0,0).\n";
3776  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3777  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3778  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3779 
3780  }
3781  }
3782  }
3783 
3784  // Check that all distributed boolean are the same (if on more than 1 core)
3785  if(comm_pt->nproc() > 1)
3786  {
3787  // Get the distributed boolean from matrix_pt(0,0)
3788  bool first_distributed = matrix_pt(0,0)->distributed();
3789 
3790  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3791  {
3792  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3793  {
3794  // Is the current block distributed?
3795  bool current_distributed
3796  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distributed();
3797 
3798  if(first_distributed != current_distributed)
3799  {
3800  std::ostringstream error_message;
3801  error_message << "Block matrix_pt(" << block_row_i
3802  << ","<<block_col_i<<") and block matrix_pt(0,0) "
3803  << "have a different distributed boolean.\n";
3804  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3805  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3806  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3807  }
3808  }
3809  }
3810  }
3811 
3812  // Check that all sub matrix dimensions "make sense"
3813  // We need to check that all the matrices in the same row has the same nrow.
3814  // Then repeat for the columns.
3815 
3816  // Check the nrow of each block row.
3817  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3818  {
3819  // Get the nrow to compare against from the first column.
3820  const unsigned first_block_nrow = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
3821 
3822  // Loop through the block columns.
3823  for (unsigned block_col_i = 1; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3824  {
3825  // If the nrow of this block is not the same as the nrow from the first
3826  // block in this block row, throw an error.
3827  const unsigned current_block_nrow
3828  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->nrow();
3829 
3830  if(first_block_nrow != current_block_nrow)
3831  {
3832  std::ostringstream error_message;
3833  error_message << "First block has nrow = " << current_block_nrow
3834  << ". But martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
3835  << "," << block_col_i <<") has nrow = "
3836  << current_block_nrow << ".\n";
3837  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3838  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3839  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3840  }
3841 
3842  }
3843  }
3844 
3845  // Check the ncol of each block column.
3846  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3847  {
3848  // Get the ncol from the first block row to compare against.
3849  const unsigned first_block_ncol = matrix_pt(0,block_col_i)->ncol();
3850 
3851  for (unsigned block_row_i = 1; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3852  {
3853  // Get the ncol for the current block.
3854  const unsigned current_block_ncol
3855  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->ncol();
3856 
3857  if(first_block_ncol != current_block_ncol)
3858  {
3859  std::ostringstream error_message;
3860  error_message << "First block has ncol = " << current_block_ncol
3861  << ". But martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
3862  << "," << block_col_i <<") has ncol = "
3863  << current_block_ncol << ".\n";
3864  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3865  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3866  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3867  }
3868  }
3869  }
3870 
3871  // Check that the distribution for each block row is the same.
3872  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3873  {
3874  // The first distribution of this block row.
3875  const LinearAlgebraDistribution first_dist
3876  = *(matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->distribution_pt());
3877 
3878  // Loop through the rest of the block columns.
3879  for (unsigned block_col_i = 1; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3880  {
3881  // Get the distribution from the current block.
3882  const LinearAlgebraDistribution current_dist
3883  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distribution_pt();
3884 
3885  // Compare the first distribution against the current.
3886  if(first_dist != current_dist)
3887  {
3888  std::ostringstream error_message;
3889  error_message << "First distribution of block row " << block_row_i
3890  << " is different from the distribution from "
3891  << "martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
3892  << "," << block_col_i <<").\n";
3893  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3894  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3895  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3896  }
3897  }
3898  }
3899 #endif
3900 
3901 #endif
3902 
3903  // Loop thrpugh the block rows, then block columns to
3904  // compute the local inf norm
3905  double inf_norm = 0;
3906  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3907  {
3908  // Get the number of local rows from the first block.
3909  unsigned block_nrow_local = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow_local();
3910 
3911  // Loop through the block_nrow_local in this block row
3912  for (unsigned local_row_i = 0; local_row_i < block_nrow_local;
3913  local_row_i++)
3914  {
3915  double abs_sum_of_row = 0;
3916  // Loop through the block columns
3917  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3918  {
3919  // Locally cache the pointer to the current block.
3920  CRDoubleMatrix* block_pt = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i);
3921 
3922  const int* row_start = block_pt->row_start();
3923  const double* value = block_pt->value();
3924 
3925  // Loop through the values
3926  for (int val_i = row_start[local_row_i];
3927  val_i < row_start[local_row_i+1]; val_i++)
3928  {
3929  abs_sum_of_row += fabs(value[val_i]);
3930  }
3931  }
3932  // Store the max row
3933  inf_norm = std::max(inf_norm,abs_sum_of_row);
3934  }
3935  }
3936 
3937  // if this vector is distributed and on multiple processors then gather
3938 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
3939  double inf_norm_local = inf_norm;
3940  if ( matrix_pt(0,0)->distributed() && comm_pt->nproc() > 1)
3941  {
3942  MPI_Allreduce(&inf_norm,&inf_norm_local,1,MPI_DOUBLE,MPI_MAX,
3943  comm_pt->mpi_comm());
3944  }
3945  inf_norm = inf_norm_local;
3946 #endif
3947 
3948  // and return
3949  return inf_norm;
3950  }
3951 
3952  //============================================================================
3953  /// \short Calculates the largest Gershgorin disc whilst preserving the sign.
3954  /// Let A be an n by n matrix, with entries aij. For \f$ i \in \{ 1,...,n \} \f$ let
3955  /// \f$ R_i = \sum_{i\neq j} |a_{ij}| \f$ be the sum of the absolute values of the
3956  /// non-diagonal entries in the i-th row. Let \f$ D(a_{ii},R_i) \f$ be the closed
3957  /// disc centered at \f$ a_{ii} \f$ with radius \f$ R_i \f$, such a disc is called a
3958  /// Gershgorin disc.
3959  ///
3960  /// \n
3961  ///
3962  /// We calculate \f$ |D(a_{ii},R_i)|_{max} \f$ and multiply by the sign of the diagonal
3963  /// entry.
3964  ///
3965  /// \n
3966  ///
3967  /// The DenseMatrix of CRDoubleMatrices are treated as if they are one
3968  /// large matrix. Therefore the dimensions of the sub matrices has to
3969  /// "make sense", there is a paranoid check for this.
3970  //============================================================================
3971  double gershgorin_eigenvalue_estimate(
3972  const DenseMatrix<CRDoubleMatrix*> &matrix_pt)
3973  {
3974 
3975  // The number of block rows and columns
3976  const unsigned nblockrow = matrix_pt.nrow();
3977  const unsigned nblockcol = matrix_pt.ncol();
3978 
3979 #ifdef PARANOID
3980  // Check that tehre is at least one matrix.
3981  if(matrix_pt.nrow() == 0)
3982  {
3983  std::ostringstream error_message;
3984  error_message << "There are no matrices... \n";
3985  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
3986  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3987  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3988  }
3989 
3990 
3991  // Check that all matrix_pt pointers are not null
3992  // and the matrices are built.
3993  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
3994  {
3995  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
3996  {
3997  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) == 0)
3998  {
3999  std::ostringstream error_message;
4000  error_message << "The pointer martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
4001  << "," << block_col_i <<") is null.\n";
4002  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4003  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4004  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4005  }
4006 
4007  if(!matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->built())
4008  {
4009  std::ostringstream error_message;
4010  error_message << "The matrix at martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
4011  << "," << block_col_i <<") is not built.\n";
4012  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4013  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4014  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4015  }
4016  }
4017  }
4018 #endif
4019 
4020 
4021 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
4022 
4023  // The communicator pointer from block (0,0)
4024  // All communicators should be the same, we check this next.
4025  const OomphCommunicator* const comm_pt
4026  = matrix_pt(0,0)->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt();
4027 
4028 #ifdef PARANOID
4029 
4030  // Check that all communicators are the same
4031  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
4032  {
4033  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
4034  {
4035  // Communicator for this block matrix.
4036  const OomphCommunicator current_block_comm
4037  = *(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)
4038  ->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt());
4039  if(*comm_pt != current_block_comm)
4040  {
4041  std::ostringstream error_message;
4042  error_message << "The communicator of block martrix_pt("<< block_row_i
4043  << "," << block_col_i <<") is not the same as block "
4044  << "matrix_pt(0,0).\n";
4045  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4046  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4047  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4048 
4049  }
4050  }
4051  }
4052 
4053  // Check that all distributed boolean are the same (if on more than 1 core)
4054  if(comm_pt->nproc() > 1)
4055  {
4056  // Get the distributed boolean from matrix_pt(0,0)
4057  bool first_distributed = matrix_pt(0,0)->distributed();
4058 
4059  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
4060  {
4061  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
4062  {
4063  // Is the current block distributed?
4064  bool current_distributed
4065  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distributed();
4066 
4067  if(first_distributed != current_distributed)
4068  {
4069  std::ostringstream error_message;
4070  error_message << "Block matrix_pt(" << block_row_i
4071  << ","<<block_col_i<<") and block matrix_pt(0,0) "
4072  << "have a different distributed boolean.\n";
4073  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4074  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4075  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4076  }
4077  }
4078  }
4079  }
4080 
4081  // Check that all sub matrix dimensions "make sense"
4082  // We need to check that all the matrices in the same row has the same nrow.
4083  // Then repeat for the columns.
4084 
4085  // Check the nrow of each block row.
4086  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
4087  {
4088  // Get the nrow to compare against from the first column.
4089  const unsigned first_block_nrow = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
4090 
4091  // Loop through the block columns.
4092  for (unsigned block_col_i = 1; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
4093  {
4094  // If the nrow of this block is not the same as the nrow from the first
4095  // block in this block row, throw an error.
4096  const unsigned current_block_nrow
4097  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->nrow();
4098 
4099  if(first_block_nrow != current_block_nrow)
4100  {
4101  std::ostringstream error_message;
4102  error_message << "First block has nrow = " << current_block_nrow
4103  << ". But martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
4104  << "," << block_col_i <<") has nrow = "
4105  << current_block_nrow << ".\n";
4106  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4107  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4108  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4109  }
4110 
4111  }
4112  }
4113 
4114  // Check the ncol of each block column.
4115  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
4116  {
4117  // Get the ncol from the first block row to compare against.
4118  const unsigned first_block_ncol = matrix_pt(0,block_col_i)->ncol();
4119 
4120  for (unsigned block_row_i = 1; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
4121  {
4122  // Get the ncol for the current block.
4123  const unsigned current_block_ncol
4124  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->ncol();
4125 
4126  if(first_block_ncol != current_block_ncol)
4127  {
4128  std::ostringstream error_message;
4129  error_message << "First block has ncol = " << current_block_ncol
4130  << ". But martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
4131  << "," << block_col_i <<") has ncol = "
4132  << current_block_ncol << ".\n";
4133  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4134  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4135  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4136  }
4137  }
4138  }
4139 
4140  // Check that the distribution for each block row is the same.
4141  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
4142  {
4143  // The first distribution of this block row.
4144  const LinearAlgebraDistribution first_dist
4145  = *(matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->distribution_pt());
4146 
4147  // Loop through the rest of the block columns.
4148  for (unsigned block_col_i = 1; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
4149  {
4150  // Get the distribution from the current block.
4151  const LinearAlgebraDistribution current_dist
4152  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distribution_pt();
4153 
4154  // Compare the first distribution against the current.
4155  if(first_dist != current_dist)
4156  {
4157  std::ostringstream error_message;
4158  error_message << "First distribution of block row " << block_row_i
4159  << " is different from the distribution from "
4160  << "martrix_pt(" << block_row_i
4161  << "," << block_col_i <<").\n";
4162  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4163  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4164  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4165  }
4166  }
4167  }
4168 
4169 #endif
4170 #endif
4171 
4172  // Loop thrpugh the block rows, then block columns to
4173  // compute the local inf norm
4174  double extreme_disc = 0;
4175  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < nblockrow; block_row_i++)
4176  {
4177  // Get the number of local rows from the first block.
4178  unsigned block_nrow_local = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow_local();
4179 
4180  // Loop through the block_nrow_local in this block row
4181  for (unsigned local_row_i = 0; local_row_i < block_nrow_local;
4182  local_row_i++)
4183  {
4184  double abs_sum_of_row = 0;
4185  // Loop through the block columns
4186  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < nblockcol; block_col_i++)
4187  {
4188  // Locally cache the pointer to the current block.
4189  CRDoubleMatrix* block_pt = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i);
4190 
4191  const int* row_start = block_pt->row_start();
4192  const double* value = block_pt->value();
4193 
4194  // Loop through the values
4195  for (int val_i = row_start[local_row_i];
4196  val_i < row_start[local_row_i+1]; val_i++)
4197  {
4198  abs_sum_of_row += fabs(value[val_i]);
4199  }
4200  }
4201 
4202  // Now minus the diagonal entry...
4203  // Locate the diagonal block matrix.
4204  double* s_values = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_row_i)->value();
4205  int* s_column_index = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_row_i)->column_index();
4206  int* s_row_start = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_row_i)->row_start();
4207  //int s_nrow_local = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_row_i)->nrow_local();
4208  int s_first_row = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_row_i)->first_row();
4209 
4210  // Get the diagonal value...
4211  double diagonal_value = 0;
4212  bool found = false;
4213  for (int j = s_row_start[local_row_i];
4214  j < s_row_start[local_row_i+1] && !found; j++)
4215  {
4216  if (s_column_index[j] == int(local_row_i + s_first_row))
4217  {
4218  diagonal_value = s_values[j];
4219  found = true;
4220  }
4221  }
4222 
4223  // Check if the diagonal entry is found.
4224  if(!found)
4225  {
4226  std::ostringstream error_message;
4227  error_message << "The diagonal entry for the block("
4228  << block_row_i<<","<<block_row_i<<")\n"
4229  << "on local row " << local_row_i << " does not exist."
4230  << std::endl;
4231  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4232  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4233  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4234  }
4235 
4236  // This is the disc.
4237  abs_sum_of_row -= fabs(diagonal_value);
4238 
4239  // Now we have to check if the diagonal entry is
4240  // on the left or right side of zero.
4241  if(diagonal_value > 0)
4242  {
4243  double extreme_disc_local = diagonal_value + abs_sum_of_row;
4244  extreme_disc = std::max(extreme_disc_local,extreme_disc);
4245  }
4246  else
4247  {
4248  double extreme_disc_local = diagonal_value - abs_sum_of_row;
4249  extreme_disc = std::min(extreme_disc_local,extreme_disc);
4250  }
4251  } // Loop through local row (of all block column)
4252  } // Loop through block row
4253 
4254  // if this vector is distributed and on multiple processors then gather
4255 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
4256  double extreme_disc_local = extreme_disc;
4257  if ( matrix_pt(0,0)->distributed() && comm_pt->nproc() > 1)
4258  {
4259  if(extreme_disc > 0)
4260  {
4261  MPI_Allreduce(&extreme_disc,&extreme_disc_local,1,MPI_DOUBLE,MPI_MAX,
4262  comm_pt->mpi_comm());
4263  }
4264  else
4265  {
4266  MPI_Allreduce(&extreme_disc,&extreme_disc_local,1,MPI_DOUBLE,MPI_MIN,
4267  comm_pt->mpi_comm());
4268  }
4269  }
4270  extreme_disc = extreme_disc_local;
4271 #endif
4272 
4273  // and return
4274  return extreme_disc;
4275  }
4276 
4277  //============================================================================
4278  /// \short Concatenate CRDoubleMatrix matrices.
4279  /// The in matrices are concatenated such that the block structure of the
4280  /// in matrices are preserved in the result matrix. Communication between
4281  /// processors is required. If the block structure of the sub matrices does
4282  /// not need to be preserved, consider using
4283  /// CRDoubleMatrixHelpers::concatenate_without_communication(...).
4284  ///
4285  /// The matrix manipulation functions
4286  /// CRDoubleMatrixHelpers::concatenate(...) and
4287  /// CRDoubleMatrixHelpers::concatenate_without_communication(...)
4288  /// are analogous to the Vector manipulation functions
4289  /// DoubleVectorHelpers::concatenate(...) and
4290  /// DoubleVectorHelpers::concatenate_without_communication(...).
4291  /// Please look at the DoubleVector functions for an illustration of the
4292  /// differences between concatenate(...) and
4293  /// concatenate_without_communication(...).
4294  ///
4295  /// Distribution of the result matrix:
4296  /// If the result matrix does not have a distribution built, then it will be
4297  /// given a uniform row distribution. Otherwise we use the existing
4298  /// distribution. This gives the user the ability to define their own
4299  /// distribution, or save computing power if a distribution has
4300  /// been pre-built.
4301  ///
4302  /// NOTE: ALL the matrices pointed to by matrix_pt has to be built. This is
4303  /// not the case with concatenate_without_communication(...)
4304  //============================================================================
4305  void concatenate(const DenseMatrix<CRDoubleMatrix*> &matrix_pt,
4306  CRDoubleMatrix &result_matrix)
4307  {
4308 
4309  // The number of block rows and block columns.
4310  unsigned matrix_nrow = matrix_pt.nrow();
4311  unsigned matrix_ncol = matrix_pt.ncol();
4312 
4313  // PARANOID checks involving only the in matrices.
4314 #ifdef PARANOID
4315  // Are there matrices to concatenate?
4316  if(matrix_nrow == 0)
4317  {
4318  std::ostringstream error_message;
4319  error_message << "There are no matrices to concatenate.\n";
4320  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4321  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4322  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4323  }
4324 
4325  // Does this matrix need concatenating?
4326  if((matrix_nrow == 1) && (matrix_ncol == 1))
4327  {
4328  std::ostringstream warning_message;
4329  warning_message << "There is only one matrix to concatenate...\n"
4330  << "This does not require concatenating...\n";
4331  OomphLibWarning(warning_message.str(),
4332  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4333  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4334  }
4335 
4336  // Are all sub matrices built?
4337  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4338  {
4339  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4340  {
4341  if (!(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->built()))
4342  {
4343  std::ostringstream error_message;
4344  error_message
4345  << "The sub matrix (" << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
4346  << "is not built. \n";
4347  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4348  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4349  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4350  }
4351  }
4352  }
4353 
4354  // Do all dimensions of sub matrices "make sense"?
4355  // Compare the number of rows of each block matrix in a block row.
4356  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4357  {
4358  // Use the first column to compare against the rest.
4359  unsigned long current_block_nrow = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
4360 
4361  // Compare against columns 1 to matrix_ncol - 1
4362  for(unsigned block_col_i = 1; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4363  {
4364  // Get the nrow for this sub block.
4365  unsigned long subblock_nrow
4366  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->nrow();
4367 
4368  if(current_block_nrow != subblock_nrow)
4369  {
4370  std::ostringstream error_message;
4371  error_message
4372  << "The sub matrix (" << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
4373  << "requires nrow = " << current_block_nrow
4374  << ", but has nrow = " << subblock_nrow <<".\n";
4375  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4376  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4377  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4378  }
4379  }
4380  }
4381 
4382  // Compare the number of columns of each block matrix in a block column.
4383  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4384  {
4385  // Use the first row to compare against the rest.
4386  unsigned long current_block_ncol = matrix_pt(0,block_col_i)->ncol();
4387 
4388  // Compare against rows 1 to matrix_nrow - 1
4389  for(unsigned block_row_i = 1; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4390  {
4391  // Get the ncol for this sub block.
4392  unsigned long subblock_ncol
4393  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->ncol();
4394 
4395  if(current_block_ncol != subblock_ncol)
4396  {
4397  std::ostringstream error_message;
4398  error_message
4399  << "The sub matrix (" << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
4400  << "requires ncol = " << current_block_ncol
4401  << ", but has ncol = " << subblock_ncol << ".\n";
4402  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4403  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4404  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4405  }
4406  }
4407  }
4408 #endif
4409 
4410  // The communicator pointer from block (0,0)
4411  const OomphCommunicator* const comm_pt
4412  = matrix_pt(0,0)->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt();
4413 
4414  // Check if the block (0,0) is distributed or not.
4415  bool distributed = matrix_pt(0,0)->distributed();
4416 
4417  // If the result matrix does not have a distribution, we create a uniform
4418  // distribution.
4419  if(!result_matrix.distribution_pt()->built())
4420  {
4421  // Sum of sub matrix nrow. We use the first column.
4422  unsigned tmp_nrow = 0;
4423  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4424  {
4425  tmp_nrow +=matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
4426  }
4427 
4428  LinearAlgebraDistribution tmp_distribution(comm_pt,tmp_nrow,distributed);
4429 
4430  result_matrix.build(&tmp_distribution);
4431  }
4432  else
4433  // A distribution is supplied for the result matrix.
4434  {
4435 #ifdef PARANOID
4436  // Check if the sum of the nrow from the sub matrices is the same as the
4437  // the nrow from the result matrix.
4438 
4439  // Sum of sub matrix nrow. We use the first column.
4440  unsigned tmp_nrow = 0;
4441  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4442  {
4443  tmp_nrow +=matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
4444  }
4445 
4446  if(tmp_nrow != result_matrix.nrow())
4447  {
4448  std::ostringstream error_message;
4449  error_message << "The total number of rows from the matrices to\n"
4450  << "concatenate does not match the nrow from the\n"
4451  << "result matrix\n";
4452  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4453  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4454  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4455  }
4456 #endif
4457  }
4458 
4459 #ifdef PARANOID
4460 
4461  // Are all the communicators the same?
4462  // Compare the communicator for sub matrices (against the result matrix).
4463  {
4464  const OomphCommunicator communicator
4465  = *(result_matrix.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt());
4466 
4467  // Are all communicator pointers the same?
4468  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4469  {
4470  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4471  {
4472  const OomphCommunicator another_communicator
4473  = *(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)
4474  ->distribution_pt()->communicator_pt());
4475 
4476  if(!(communicator == another_communicator))
4477  {
4478  std::ostringstream error_message;
4479  error_message
4480  << "The OomphCommunicator of the sub matrix ("
4481  << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
4482  << "does not have the same communicator as the result matrix. \n";
4483  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4484  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4485  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4486  }
4487  }
4488  }
4489  }
4490 
4491  // Are all the distributed boolean the same? This only applies if we have
4492  // more than one processor. If there is only one processor, then it does
4493  // not matter if it is distributed or not - they are conceptually the same.
4494  if(comm_pt->nproc() != 1)
4495  {
4496  // Compare distributed for sub matrices (against the result matrix).
4497  const bool res_distributed = result_matrix.distributed();
4498 
4499  // Loop over all sub blocks.
4500  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4501  {
4502  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4503  {
4504  const bool another_distributed
4505  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distributed();
4506 
4507  if(res_distributed != another_distributed)
4508  {
4509  std::ostringstream error_message;
4510  error_message
4511  << "The distributed boolean of the sub matrix ("
4512  << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
4513  << "is not the same as the result matrix. \n";
4514  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
4515  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4516  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4517  }
4518  }
4519  }
4520  }
4521 #endif
4522 
4523 
4524  // Get the number of columns up to each block for offset
4525  // in calculating the result column indices.
4526  // Since the number of columns in each block column is the same,
4527  // we only loop through the first block row (row zero).
4528  Vector<unsigned long> sum_of_ncol_up_to_block(matrix_ncol);
4529 
4530  // Also compute the total number of columns to build the resulting matrix.
4531  unsigned long res_ncol = 0;
4532 
4533  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4534  {
4535  sum_of_ncol_up_to_block[block_col_i] = res_ncol;
4536  res_ncol += matrix_pt(0,block_col_i)->ncol();
4537  }
4538 
4539  // We begin the process of extracting and ordering the values,
4540  // column_indices and row_start of all the sub blocks.
4541  if((comm_pt->nproc() == 1) || !distributed)
4542  // Serial version of the code.
4543  {
4544  // Get the total number of non zero entries so we can reserve storage for
4545  // the values and column_indices vectors.
4546  unsigned long res_nnz = 0;
4547  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0;
4548  block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4549  {
4550  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0;
4551  block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4552  {
4553  res_nnz+=matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->nnz();
4554  }
4555  }
4556 
4557  // Declare the vectors required to build a CRDoubleMatrix
4558  Vector<double> res_values;
4559  Vector<int> res_column_indices;
4560  Vector<int> res_row_start;
4561 
4562  // Reserve space for the vectors.
4563  res_values.reserve(res_nnz);
4564  res_column_indices.reserve(res_nnz);
4565  res_row_start.reserve(result_matrix.nrow()+1);
4566 
4567  // Now we fill in the data.
4568 
4569  // Running sum of nnz per row.
4570  int nnz_running_sum = 0;
4571 
4572  // Loop through the block rows.
4573  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4574  {
4575  // Get the number of rows in this block row, from the first block.
4576  unsigned long block_row_nrow = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
4577 
4578  // Loop through the number of rows in this block row
4579  for (unsigned row_i = 0; row_i < block_row_nrow; row_i++)
4580  {
4581  // The row start is the nnz at the start of the row.
4582  res_row_start.push_back(nnz_running_sum);
4583 
4584  // Loop through the block columns
4585  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0;
4586  block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4587  {
4588  // Get the current block.
4589  CRDoubleMatrix* current_block_pt
4590  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i);
4591 
4592  // Get the values, column_indices and row_start for this block.
4593  double* current_block_values = current_block_pt->value();
4594  int* current_block_column_indices
4595  = current_block_pt->column_index();
4596  int* current_block_row_start = current_block_pt->row_start();
4597 
4598  for (int val_i = current_block_row_start[row_i];
4599  val_i < current_block_row_start[row_i+1]; val_i++)
4600  {
4601  res_values.push_back(current_block_values[val_i]);
4602  res_column_indices.push_back(current_block_column_indices[val_i]
4603  + sum_of_ncol_up_to_block[block_col_i]);
4604  }
4605 
4606  // Update the running sum of nnz per row
4607  nnz_running_sum += current_block_row_start[row_i+1]
4608  - current_block_row_start[row_i];
4609  } // for block cols
4610  } // for rows
4611  } // for block rows
4612 
4613  // Fill in the last row start
4614  res_row_start.push_back(res_nnz);
4615 
4616  // Build the matrix
4617  result_matrix.build(res_ncol,res_values,res_column_indices,res_row_start);
4618  }
4619  // Otherwise we are dealing with a distributed matrix.
4620  else
4621  {
4622 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
4623 
4624  // Flag to enable timing. This is for debugging
4625  // and/or testing purposes only.
4626  bool enable_timing = false;
4627 
4628  // Get the number of processors
4629  unsigned nproc = comm_pt->nproc();
4630 
4631  // My rank
4632  unsigned my_rank = comm_pt->my_rank();
4633 
4634  // Storage for the data (per processor) to send.
4635  Vector<Vector<unsigned> > column_indices_to_send(nproc);
4636  Vector<Vector<double> > values_to_send(nproc);
4637 
4638  // The sum of the nrow for the sub blocks (so far). This is used as an
4639  // offset to calculate the global equation number in the result matrix.
4640  unsigned long sum_of_block_nrow = 0;
4641 
4642  double t_prep_data_start;
4643  if(enable_timing)
4644  {
4645  t_prep_data_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
4646  }
4647 
4648  // Get the pointer to the result distribution, for convenience...
4649  LinearAlgebraDistribution* res_distribution_pt
4650  = result_matrix.distribution_pt();
4651 
4652  // loop over the sub blocks to calculate the global_eqn, get the values
4653  // and column indices.
4654  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
4655  {
4656  // Get the number of local rows in this block_row from the first block.
4657  unsigned current_block_nrow_local = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)
4658  ->nrow_local();
4659 
4660  // Get the first_row for this block_row
4661  unsigned current_block_row_first_row = matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)
4662  ->first_row();
4663 
4664  // Loop through the number of local rows
4665  for(unsigned sub_local_eqn = 0;
4666  sub_local_eqn < current_block_nrow_local; sub_local_eqn++)
4667  {
4668  // Calculate the corresponding (res_global_eqn) equation number
4669  // for this local row number in this block.
4670  unsigned long res_global_eqn = sub_local_eqn
4671  + current_block_row_first_row + sum_of_block_nrow;
4672 
4673  // Get the processor that this global row belongs to.
4674  // The rank_of_global_row(...) function loops through all the
4675  // processors and does two unsigned comparisons. Since we have to do
4676  // this for every row, it may be better to store a list mapping for
4677  // very large number of processors.
4678  unsigned res_p = res_distribution_pt
4679  ->rank_of_global_row(res_global_eqn);
4680 
4681  // With the res_p, we get the res_first_row to
4682  // work out the res_local_eqn
4683  unsigned res_first_row = res_distribution_pt->first_row(res_p);
4684  unsigned res_local_eqn = res_global_eqn - res_first_row;
4685 
4686  // Loop through the block columns, calculate the nnz. This is used to
4687  // reserve space for the value and column_indices Vectors.
4688  unsigned long current_row_nnz = 0;
4689  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0;
4690  block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4691  {
4692  // Get the row_start
4693  int* current_block_row_start = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)
4694  ->row_start();
4695 
4696  // Update the nnz for this row.
4697  current_row_nnz += current_block_row_start[sub_local_eqn+1]
4698  - current_block_row_start[sub_local_eqn];
4699  } // for block column, get nnz.
4700 
4701  // Reserve space for efficiency.
4702  //unsigned capacity_in_res_p_vec
4703  // = column_indices_to_send[res_p].capacity();
4704 
4705  // Reserve memory for nnz+2, since we need to store the res_local_eqn
4706  // and nnz as well as the data (values/column indices).
4707  // Note: The two reserve functions are called per row.
4708  // If the matrix is very sparse (just a few elements per row), it
4709  // will be more efficient to not reserve and let the STL vector
4710  // handle this. On average, this implementation is more efficient.
4711  //column_indices_to_send[res_p].reserve(capacity_in_res_p_vec
4712  // + current_row_nnz+2);
4713  //values_to_send[res_p].reserve(capacity_in_res_p_vec
4714  // + current_row_nnz+2);
4715 
4716  // Push back the res_local_eqn and nnz
4717  column_indices_to_send[res_p].push_back(res_local_eqn);
4718  column_indices_to_send[res_p].push_back(current_row_nnz);
4719  values_to_send[res_p].push_back(res_local_eqn);
4720  values_to_send[res_p].push_back(current_row_nnz);
4721 
4722  // Loop through the block columns again and get the values
4723  // and column_indices
4724  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0;
4725  block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
4726  {
4727  // Cache the pointer to the current block for convenience.
4728  CRDoubleMatrix* current_block_pt
4729  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i);
4730 
4731  // Values, column indices and row_start for the current block.
4732  double* current_block_values = current_block_pt->value();
4733  int* current_block_column_indices
4734  = current_block_pt->column_index();
4735  int* current_block_row_start = current_block_pt->row_start();
4736 
4737  // Loop though the values and column_indices
4738  for (int val_i = current_block_row_start[sub_local_eqn];
4739  val_i < current_block_row_start[sub_local_eqn+1]; val_i++)
4740  {
4741  // Push back the value.
4742  values_to_send[res_p].push_back(current_block_values[val_i]);
4743 
4744  // Push back the (offset) column index.
4745  column_indices_to_send[res_p].push_back(
4746  current_block_column_indices[val_i]
4747  + sum_of_ncol_up_to_block[block_col_i]);
4748  } // for block columns
4749  } // for block column, get values and column_indices.
4750  } // for sub_local_eqn
4751 
4752  // update the sum_of_block_nrow
4753  sum_of_block_nrow += matrix_pt(block_row_i,0)->nrow();
4754 
4755  } // for block_row
4756 
4757  if(enable_timing)
4758  {
4759  double t_prep_data_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
4760  double t_prep_data_time = t_prep_data_finish - t_prep_data_start;
4761  oomph_info << "Time for prep data: " << t_prep_data_time << std::endl;
4762  }
4763 
4764  // Prepare to send data!
4765 
4766  // Storage for the number of data to be sent to each processor.
4767  Vector<int> send_n(nproc,0);
4768 
4769  // Storage for all the values/column indices to be sent
4770  // to each processor.
4771  Vector<double> send_values_data;
4772  Vector<unsigned> send_column_indices_data;
4773 
4774  // Storage location within send_values_data
4775  // (and send_column_indices_data) for data to be sent to each processor.
4776  Vector<int> send_displacement(nproc,0);
4777 
4778  double t_total_ndata_start;
4779  if(enable_timing)
4780  t_total_ndata_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
4781 
4782  // Get the total amount of data which needs to be sent, so we can reserve
4783  // space for it.
4784  unsigned total_ndata = 0;
4785  for (unsigned rank = 0; rank < nproc; rank++)
4786  {
4787  if(rank != my_rank)
4788  {
4789  total_ndata += values_to_send[rank].size();
4790  }
4791  }
4792 
4793  if(enable_timing)
4794  {
4795  double t_total_ndata_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
4796  double t_total_ndata_time= t_total_ndata_finish - t_total_ndata_start;
4797  oomph_info << "Time for total_ndata: " << t_total_ndata_time << std::endl;
4798  }
4799 
4800  double t_flat_pack_start;
4801  if(enable_timing)
4802  t_flat_pack_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
4803 
4804  // Now we don't have to re-allocate data/memory when push_back is called.
4805  // Nb. Using push_back without reserving memory may cause multiple
4806  // re-allocation behind the scenes, this is expensive.
4807  send_values_data.reserve(total_ndata);
4808  send_column_indices_data.reserve(total_ndata);
4809 
4810  // Loop over all the processors to "flat pack" the data for sending.
4811  for (unsigned rank = 0; rank < nproc; rank++)
4812  {
4813  // Set the offset for the current processor
4814  // This only has to be done once for both values and column indices.
4815  send_displacement[rank] = send_values_data.size();
4816 
4817  // Don't bother to do anything if
4818  // the processor in the loop is the current processor.
4819  if(rank != my_rank)
4820  {
4821  // Put the values into the send data vector.
4822  // n_data is the same for both values and column indices.
4823  unsigned n_data = values_to_send[rank].size();
4824  for (unsigned j = 0; j < n_data; j++)
4825  {
4826  send_values_data.push_back(values_to_send[rank][j]);
4827  send_column_indices_data.push_back(
4828  column_indices_to_send[rank][j]);
4829  } // for
4830  } // if rank != my_rank
4831 
4832  // Find the number of data to be added to the vector.
4833  // send_n is the same for both values and column indices.
4834  send_n[rank] = send_values_data.size() - send_displacement[rank];
4835  } // loop over processors
4836 
4837  if(enable_timing)
4838  {
4839  double t_flat_pack_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
4840  double t_flat_pack_time = t_flat_pack_finish - t_flat_pack_start;
4841  oomph_info << "t_flat_pack_time: " << t_flat_pack_time << std::endl;
4842  }
4843 
4844  double t_sendn_start;
4845  if(enable_timing)
4846  t_sendn_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
4847 
4848  // Strorage for the number of data to be received from each processor
4849  Vector<int> receive_n(nproc,0);
4850 
4851  MPI_Alltoall(&send_n[0],1,MPI_INT,&receive_n[0],1,MPI_INT,
4852  comm_pt->mpi_comm());
4853 
4854  if(enable_timing)
4855  {
4856  double t_sendn_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
4857  double t_sendn_time = t_sendn_finish - t_sendn_start;
4858  oomph_info << "t_sendn_time: " << t_sendn_time << std::endl;
4859  }
4860 
4861 
4862  // Prepare the data to be received
4863  // by working out the displacement from the received data
4864  // receive_displacement is the same for both values and column indices.
4865  Vector<int> receive_displacement(nproc,0);
4866  int receive_data_count = 0;
4867  for (unsigned rank = 0; rank < nproc; rank++)
4868  {
4869  receive_displacement[rank] = receive_data_count;
4870  receive_data_count += receive_n[rank];
4871  }
4872 
4873  // Now resize the receive buffer for all data from all processors.
4874  // Make sure that it has a size of at least one.
4875  if(receive_data_count == 0){receive_data_count++;}
4876  Vector<double> receive_values_data(receive_data_count);
4877  Vector<unsigned> receive_column_indices_data(receive_data_count);
4878 
4879  // Make sure that the send buffer has size at least one
4880  // so that we don't get a segmentation fault.
4881  if(send_values_data.size()==0){send_values_data.resize(1);}
4882 
4883  double t_send_data_start;
4884  if(enable_timing)
4885  t_send_data_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
4886 
4887  // Now send the data between all processors
4888  MPI_Alltoallv(&send_values_data[0],&send_n[0],&send_displacement[0],
4889  MPI_DOUBLE,
4890  &receive_values_data[0],&receive_n[0],
4891  &receive_displacement[0],
4892  MPI_DOUBLE,
4893  comm_pt->mpi_comm());
4894 
4895  // Now send the data between all processors
4896  MPI_Alltoallv(&send_column_indices_data[0],&send_n[0],
4897  &send_displacement[0],
4898  MPI_UNSIGNED,
4899  &receive_column_indices_data[0],&receive_n[0],
4900  &receive_displacement[0],
4901  MPI_UNSIGNED,
4902  comm_pt->mpi_comm());
4903 
4904  if(enable_timing)
4905  {
4906  double t_send_data_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
4907  double t_send_data_time = t_send_data_finish - t_send_data_start;
4908  oomph_info << "t_send_data_time: " << t_send_data_time << std::endl;
4909  }
4910 
4911  // All the rows for this processor are stored in:
4912  // from other processors:
4913  // receive_column_indices_data and receive_values_data
4914  // from this processor:
4915  // column_indices_to_send[my_rank] and values_to_send[my_rank]
4916  //
4917  // They are in some order determined by the distribution.
4918  // We need to re-arrange them. To do this, we do some pre-processing.
4919 
4920  // nrow_local for this processor.
4921  unsigned res_nrow_local = res_distribution_pt->nrow_local();
4922 
4923  // Per row, store:
4924  // 1) where this row came from, 0 - this proc, 1 - other procs.
4925  // 2) the nnz,
4926  // 3) the offset - where the values/columns in the receive data vectors
4927  // begins. This is different from the offset of where
4928  // the data from a certain processor starts.
4929  Vector<Vector<unsigned> > value_column_locations(res_nrow_local,
4930  Vector<unsigned>(3,0));
4931 
4932  // Store the local nnz so we can reserve space for
4933  // the values and column indices.
4934  unsigned long res_nnz_local = 0;
4935 
4936  double t_locations_start;
4937  if(enable_timing)
4938  t_locations_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
4939 
4940  // Loop through the data currently on this processor.
4941  unsigned location_i = 0;
4942  unsigned my_column_indices_to_send_size
4943  = column_indices_to_send[my_rank].size();
4944  while(location_i < my_column_indices_to_send_size)
4945  {
4946  unsigned current_local_eqn
4947  = column_indices_to_send[my_rank][location_i++];
4948 
4949  unsigned current_nnz
4950  = column_indices_to_send[my_rank][location_i++];
4951 
4952  // No need to fill [*][0] with 0 since it is already initialised to 0.
4953 
4954  // Store the nnz.
4955  value_column_locations[current_local_eqn][1] = current_nnz;
4956 
4957  // Also increment the res_local_nnz
4958  res_nnz_local += current_nnz;
4959 
4960  // Store the offset.
4961  value_column_locations[current_local_eqn][2] = location_i;
4962 
4963  // Update the location_i so it starts at the next row.
4964  location_i += current_nnz;
4965  }
4966 
4967  // Loop through the data from different processors.
4968 
4969  // Check to see if data has been received.
4970  bool data_has_been_received = false;
4971  unsigned send_rank = 0;
4972  while(send_rank < nproc)
4973  {
4974  if(receive_n[send_rank] > 0)
4975  {
4976  data_has_been_received = true;
4977  break;
4978  }
4979  send_rank++;
4980  }
4981 
4982  location_i = 0; // start at 0.
4983  if(data_has_been_received)
4984  {
4985  unsigned receive_column_indices_data_size
4986  = receive_column_indices_data.size();
4987  while(location_i < receive_column_indices_data_size)
4988  {
4989  unsigned current_local_eqn
4990  = receive_column_indices_data[location_i++];
4991  unsigned current_nnz = receive_column_indices_data[location_i++];
4992 
4993  // These comes from other processors.
4994  value_column_locations[current_local_eqn][0] = 1;
4995 
4996  // Store the nnz.
4997  value_column_locations[current_local_eqn][1] = current_nnz;
4998 
4999  // Also increment the res_local_nnz
5000  res_nnz_local += current_nnz;
5001 
5002  // Store the offset.
5003  value_column_locations[current_local_eqn][2] = location_i;
5004 
5005  // Update the location_i so it starts at the next row.
5006  location_i += current_nnz;
5007  }
5008  }
5009 
5010  if(enable_timing)
5011  {
5012  double t_locations_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
5013  double t_locations_time = t_locations_finish - t_locations_start;
5014  oomph_info << "t_locations_time: " << t_locations_time << std::endl;
5015  }
5016 
5017  double t_fillvecs_start;
5018  if(enable_timing)
5019  t_fillvecs_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
5020 
5021  // Now loop through the locations and store the values
5022  // the column indices in the correct order.
5023  Vector<int> res_column_indices;
5024  Vector<double> res_values;
5025  Vector<int> res_row_start;
5026 
5027  res_column_indices.reserve(res_nnz_local);
5028  res_values.reserve(res_nnz_local);
5029  res_row_start.reserve(res_nrow_local+1);
5030 
5031  // Running sum of nnz for the row_start. Must be int because
5032  // res_row_start is templated with int.
5033  int nnz_running_sum = 0;
5034 
5035  // Now insert the rows.
5036  for (unsigned local_row_i = 0;
5037  local_row_i < res_nrow_local; local_row_i++)
5038  {
5039  // Fill the res_row_start with the nnz so far.
5040  res_row_start.push_back(nnz_running_sum);
5041 
5042  bool data_is_from_other_proc
5043  = bool(value_column_locations[local_row_i][0]);
5044 
5045  unsigned row_i_nnz = value_column_locations[local_row_i][1];
5046 
5047  unsigned row_i_offset = value_column_locations[local_row_i][2];
5048 
5049  if(data_is_from_other_proc)
5050  {
5051  // Insert range [offset, offset+nnz) from
5052  // receive_column_indices_data and receive_values_data into
5053  // res_column_indices and res_values respectively.
5054  res_column_indices.insert(res_column_indices.end(),
5055  receive_column_indices_data.begin()
5056  +row_i_offset,
5057  receive_column_indices_data.begin()
5058  +row_i_offset+row_i_nnz);
5059 
5060  res_values.insert(res_values.end(),
5061  receive_values_data.begin()+row_i_offset,
5062  receive_values_data.begin()+row_i_offset+row_i_nnz);
5063  }
5064  else
5065  {
5066  res_column_indices.insert(res_column_indices.end(),
5067  column_indices_to_send[my_rank].begin()
5068  +row_i_offset,
5069  column_indices_to_send[my_rank].begin()
5070  +row_i_offset+row_i_nnz);
5071 
5072  res_values.insert(res_values.end(),
5073  values_to_send[my_rank].begin()+row_i_offset,
5074  values_to_send[my_rank].begin()+row_i_offset+row_i_nnz);
5075  }
5076 
5077  // Update the running sum of nnz
5078  nnz_running_sum += row_i_nnz;
5079  }
5080 
5081  // Insert the last row_start value
5082  res_row_start.push_back(res_nnz_local);
5083 
5084  if(enable_timing)
5085  {
5086  double t_fillvecs_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
5087  double t_fillvecs_time = t_fillvecs_finish - t_fillvecs_start;
5088  oomph_info << "t_fillvecs_time: " << t_fillvecs_time << std::endl;
5089  }
5090 
5091  double t_buildres_start;
5092  if(enable_timing)
5093  t_buildres_start = TimingHelpers::timer();
5094 
5095  // build the matrix.
5096  result_matrix.build(res_ncol,res_values,res_column_indices,res_row_start);
5097 
5098  if(enable_timing)
5099  {
5100  double t_buildres_finish = TimingHelpers::timer();
5101  double t_buildres_time = t_buildres_finish - t_buildres_start;
5102  oomph_info << "t_buildres_time: " << t_buildres_time << std::endl;
5103  }
5104  // */
5105 #endif
5106  }
5107  }
5108 
5109  //============================================================================
5110  /// \short Concatenate CRDoubleMatrix matrices.
5111  ///
5112  /// The Vector row_distribution_pt contains the LinearAlgebraDistribution
5113  /// of each block row.
5114  /// The Vector col_distribution_pt contains the LinearAlgebraDistribution
5115  /// of each block column.
5116  /// The DenseMatrix matrix_pt contains pointers to the CRDoubleMatrices
5117  /// to concatenate.
5118  /// The CRDoubleMatrix result_matrix is the result matrix.
5119  ///
5120  /// The result matrix is a permutation of the sub matrices such that the data
5121  /// stays on the same processor when the result matrix is built, there is no
5122  /// communication between processors.
5123  /// Thus the block structure of the sub matrices are NOT preserved in the
5124  /// result matrix. The rows are block-permuted, defined by the concatenation
5125  /// of the distributions in row_distribution_pt. Similarly, the columns are
5126  /// block-permuted, defined by the concatenation of the distributions in
5127  /// col_distribution_pt.
5128  /// For more details on the block-permutation, see
5129  /// LinearAlgebraDistributionHelpers::concatenate(...).
5130  ///
5131  /// If one wishes to preserve the block structure of the sub matrices in the
5132  /// result matrix, consider using CRDoubleMatrixHelpers::concatenate(...),
5133  /// which uses communication between processors to ensure that the block
5134  /// structure of the sub matrices are preserved.
5135  ///
5136  /// The matrix manipulation functions
5137  /// CRDoubleMatrixHelpers::concatenate(...) and
5138  /// CRDoubleMatrixHelpers::concatenate_without_communication(...)
5139  /// are analogous to the Vector manipulation functions
5140  /// DoubleVectorHelpers::concatenate(...) and
5141  /// DoubleVectorHelpers::concatenate_without_communication(...).
5142  /// Please look at the DoubleVector functions for an illustration of the
5143  /// differences between concatenate(...) and
5144  /// concatenate_without_communication(...).
5145  ///
5146  /// Distribution of the result matrix:
5147  /// If the result matrix does not have a distribution built, then it will be
5148  /// given a distribution built from the concatenation of the distributions
5149  /// from row_distribution_pt, see
5150  /// LinearAlgebraDistributionHelpers::concatenate(...) for more detail.
5151  /// Otherwise we use the existing distribution.
5152  /// If there is an existing distribution then it must be the same as the
5153  /// distribution from the concatenation of row distributions as described
5154  /// above.
5155  /// Why don't we always compute the distribution "on the fly"?
5156  /// Because a non-uniform distribution requires communication.
5157  /// All block preconditioner distributions are concatenations of the
5158  /// distributions of the individual blocks.
5159  //============================================================================
5160  void concatenate_without_communication(
5161  const Vector<LinearAlgebraDistribution*> &row_distribution_pt,
5162  const Vector<LinearAlgebraDistribution*> &col_distribution_pt,
5163  const DenseMatrix<CRDoubleMatrix*> &matrix_pt,
5164  CRDoubleMatrix &result_matrix)
5165  {
5166  // The number of block rows and block columns.
5167  unsigned matrix_nrow = matrix_pt.nrow();
5168  unsigned matrix_ncol = matrix_pt.ncol();
5169 
5170  // PARANOID checks involving in matrices and block_distribution only.
5171  // PARANOID checks involving the result matrix will come later since
5172  // we have to create the result matrix distribution from the in distribution
5173  // if it does not already exist.
5174 #ifdef PARANOID
5175 
5176  // Are there matrices to concatenate?
5177  if(matrix_nrow == 0 || matrix_ncol == 0)
5178  {
5179  std::ostringstream error_message;
5180  error_message << "There are no matrices to concatenate.\n";
5181  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5182  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5183  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5184  }
5185 
5186  // Does this matrix need concatenating?
5187  if((matrix_nrow == 1) && (matrix_ncol == 1))
5188  {
5189  std::ostringstream warning_message;
5190  warning_message << "There is only one matrix to concatenate...\n"
5191  << "This does not require concatenating...\n";
5192  OomphLibWarning(warning_message.str(),
5193  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5194  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5195  }
5196 
5197 
5198 
5199  // The distribution for each block row is stored in row_distribution_pt.
5200  // So the number of distributions in row_distribution_pt must be the
5201  // same as matrix_nrow.
5202  if(matrix_nrow != row_distribution_pt.size())
5203  {
5204  std::ostringstream error_message;
5205  error_message << "The number of row distributions must be the same as\n"
5206  << "the number of block rows.";
5207  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5208  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5209  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5210  }
5211 
5212  // The number of distributions for the columns must match the number of
5213  // block columns.
5214  if(matrix_ncol != col_distribution_pt.size())
5215  {
5216  std::ostringstream error_message;
5217  error_message << "The number of column distributions must be the same as\n"
5218  << "the number of block columns.";
5219  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5220  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5221  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5222  }
5223 
5224  // Check that all pointers in row_distribution_pt is not null.
5225  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5226  {
5227  if(row_distribution_pt[block_row_i] == 0)
5228  {
5229  std::ostringstream error_message;
5230  error_message << "The row distribution pointer in position "
5231  << block_row_i <<" is null.\n";
5232  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5233  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5234  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5235  }
5236  }
5237 
5238  // Check that all pointers in row_distribution_pt is not null.
5239  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5240  {
5241  if(col_distribution_pt[block_col_i] == 0)
5242  {
5243  std::ostringstream error_message;
5244  error_message << "The column distribution pointer in position "
5245  << block_col_i <<" is null.\n";
5246  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5247  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5248  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5249  }
5250  }
5251 
5252  // Check that all distributions are built.
5253  // First the row distributions
5254  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5255  {
5256  if(!row_distribution_pt[block_row_i]->built())
5257  {
5258  std::ostringstream error_message;
5259  error_message << "The distribution pointer in position "
5260  << block_row_i <<" is not built.\n";
5261  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5262  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5263  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5264  }
5265  }
5266  // Now the column distributions
5267  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5268  {
5269  if(!col_distribution_pt[block_col_i]->built())
5270  {
5271  std::ostringstream error_message;
5272  error_message << "The distribution pointer in position "
5273  << block_col_i <<" is not built.\n";
5274  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5275  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5276  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5277  }
5278  }
5279 
5280  // Check that all communicators in row_distribution_pt are the same.
5281  const OomphCommunicator first_row_comm
5282  = *(row_distribution_pt[0]->communicator_pt());
5283 
5284  for (unsigned block_row_i = 1; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5285  {
5286  const OomphCommunicator current_comm
5287  = *(row_distribution_pt[block_row_i]->communicator_pt());
5288 
5289  if(first_row_comm != current_comm)
5290  {
5291  std::ostringstream error_message;
5292  error_message <<"The communicator from the row distribution in position "
5293  << block_row_i << " is not the same as the first "
5294  << "communicator from row_distribution_pt";
5295  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5296  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5297  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5298  }
5299  }
5300 
5301  // Check that all communicators in col_distribution_pt are the same as the
5302  // first row communicator from above.
5303  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5304  {
5305  const OomphCommunicator current_comm
5306  = *(col_distribution_pt[block_col_i]->communicator_pt());
5307
