5308  if(first_row_comm != current_comm)
5309  {
5310  std::ostringstream error_message;
5311  error_message <<"The communicator from the col distribution in position "
5312  << block_col_i << " is not the same as the first "
5313  << "communicator from row_distribution_pt";
5314  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5315  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5316  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5317  }
5318  }
5319 
5320  // Are all sub matrices built? If the matrix_pt is not null, make sure
5321  // that it is built.
5322  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5323  {
5324  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5325  {
5326  if (matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) != 0 &&
5327  !(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->built()))
5328  {
5329  std::ostringstream error_message;
5330  error_message
5331  << "The sub matrix_pt(" << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
5332  << "is not built.\n";
5333  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5334  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5335  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5336  }
5337  }
5338  }
5339 
5340  // For the matrices which are built, do they have the same communicator as
5341  // the first communicator from row_distribution_pt?
5342  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5343  {
5344  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5345  {
5346  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) != 0)
5347  {
5348  const OomphCommunicator current_comm
5349  = *(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)
5350  ->distribution_pt()
5351  ->communicator_pt());
5352  if(first_row_comm != current_comm)
5353  {
5354  std::ostringstream error_message;
5355  error_message
5356  << "The sub matrix_pt(" << block_row_i << ","<<block_col_i<< ")\n"
5357  << "does not have the same communicator pointer as those in\n"
5358  << "(row|col)_distribution_pt.\n";
5359  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5360  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5361  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5362  }
5363  }
5364  }
5365  }
5366 
5367  // Do all dimensions of sub matrices "make sense"?
5368  // Compare the number of rows of each block matrix in a block row.
5369  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5370  {
5371  // Use the first column to compare against the rest.
5372  unsigned long current_block_nrow = row_distribution_pt[block_row_i]
5373  ->nrow();
5374 
5375  // Compare against columns 0 to matrix_ncol - 1
5376  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5377  {
5378  // Perform the check if the matrix_pt is not null.
5379  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) != 0)
5380  {
5381  // Get the nrow for this sub block.
5382  unsigned long subblock_nrow
5383  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->nrow();
5384 
5385  if(current_block_nrow != subblock_nrow)
5386  {
5387  std::ostringstream error_message;
5388  error_message
5389  << "The sub matrix (" << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
5390  << "requires nrow = " << current_block_nrow
5391  << ", but has nrow = " << subblock_nrow <<".\n"
5392  << "Either the row_distribution_pt is incorrect or "
5393  << "the sub matrices are incorrect.\n";
5394  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5395  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5396  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5397  }
5398  }
5399  }
5400  }
5401 
5402  // Compare the number of columns of each block matrix in a block column.
5403  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5404  {
5405  // Get the current block ncol from the linear algebra distribution.
5406  // Note that we assume that the dimensions are symmetrical.
5407  unsigned current_block_ncol = col_distribution_pt[block_col_i]
5408  ->nrow();
5409 
5410  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0;
5411  block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5412  {
5413  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) != 0)
5414  {
5415  // Get the ncol for this sub block.
5416  unsigned subblock_ncol
5417  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->ncol();
5418 
5419  if(current_block_ncol != subblock_ncol)
5420  {
5421  std::ostringstream error_message;
5422  error_message
5423  << "The sub matrix (" << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
5424  << "requires ncol = " << current_block_ncol
5425  << ", but has ncol = " << subblock_ncol << ".\n"
5426  << "Either the col_distribution_pt is incorrect or "
5427  << "the sub matrices are incorrect.\n";
5428  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5429  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5430  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5431  }
5432  }
5433  }
5434  }
5435 
5436  // Ensure that the distributions for all sub matrices in the same block row
5437  // are the same. This is because we permute the row across several matrices.
5438 
5439  // Loop through each block row.
5440  for (unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5441  {
5442  // Get the distribution from the first block in this row.
5443  LinearAlgebraDistribution* block_row_distribution_pt
5444  = row_distribution_pt[block_row_i];
5445 
5446  // Loop through the block columns
5447  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5448  {
5449  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) != 0)
5450  {
5451  // Get the distribution for this block.
5452  LinearAlgebraDistribution* current_block_distribution_pt
5453  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distribution_pt();
5454 
5455  // Ensure that the in matrices is a square block matrix.
5456  if((*block_row_distribution_pt) != (*current_block_distribution_pt))
5457  {
5458  std::ostringstream error_message;
5459  error_message << "Sub block("<<block_row_i<<","<<block_col_i<<")"
5460  << "does not have the same distributoin as the first"
5461  << "block in this block row.\n"
5462  << "All distributions on a block row must be the same"
5463  << "for this function to concatenate matrices.\n";
5464  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5465  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5466  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5467  }
5468  }
5469  }
5470  }
5471 #endif
5472 
5473  // The communicator pointer from the first row_distribution_pt
5474  const OomphCommunicator* const comm_pt
5475  = row_distribution_pt[0]->communicator_pt();
5476 
5477  // Renamed for so it makes more sense.
5478  unsigned nblock_row = matrix_nrow;
5479 
5480  // If the result matrix does not have a distribution, then we concatenate
5481  // the sub matrix distributions.
5482  if(!result_matrix.distribution_pt()->built())
5483  {
5484  // The result distribution
5485  LinearAlgebraDistribution tmp_distribution;
5486  LinearAlgebraDistributionHelpers::concatenate(row_distribution_pt,
5487  tmp_distribution);
5488 
5489  result_matrix.build(&tmp_distribution);
5490  }
5491  else
5492  // A distribution is supplied for the result matrix.
5493  {
5494 #ifdef PARANOID
5495  // Check that the result distribution is a concatenation of the
5496  // distributions of the sub matrices.
5497 
5498  LinearAlgebraDistribution wanted_distribution;
5499 
5500  LinearAlgebraDistributionHelpers::concatenate(row_distribution_pt,
5501  wanted_distribution);
5502 
5503  if(*(result_matrix.distribution_pt()) != wanted_distribution)
5504  {
5505  std::ostringstream error_message;
5506  error_message << "The result distribution is not correct.\n"
5507  << "Please call the function without a result\n"
5508  << "distribution (clear the result matrix) or check the\n"
5509  << "distribution of the result matrix.\n"
5510  << "The result distribution must be the same as the one \n"
5511  << "created by\n"
5512  << "LinearAlgebraDistributionHelpers::concatenate(...)";
5513  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5514  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5515  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5516  }
5517 #endif
5518  }
5519 
5520  // The rest of the paranoid checks.
5521 #ifdef PARANOID
5522 
5523  // Make sure that the communicator from the result matrix is the same as
5524  // all the others. This test is redundant if this function created the
5525  // result matrix distribution, since then it is guaranteed that the
5526  // communicators are the same.
5527  {
5528  // Communicator from the result matrix.
5529  const OomphCommunicator res_comm
5530  = *(result_matrix.distribution_pt()->communicator_pt());
5531 
5532  // Is the result communicator pointer the same as the others?
5533  // Since we have already tested the others, we only need to compare against
5534  // one of them. Say the first communicator from row_distribution_pt.
5535  const OomphCommunicator first_comm
5536  = *(row_distribution_pt[0]->communicator_pt());
5537 
5538  if(res_comm != first_comm)
5539  {
5540  std::ostringstream error_message;
5541  error_message
5542  << "The OomphCommunicator of the result matrix is not the same as the "
5543  << "others!";
5544  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5545  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5546  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5547  }
5548  }
5549 
5550  // Are all the distributed boolean the same? This only applies if we have
5551  // more than one processor. If there is only one processor, then it does
5552  // not matter if it is distributed or not - they are conceptually the same.
5553  if(comm_pt->nproc() != 1)
5554  {
5555  // Compare distributed for sub matrices (against the result matrix).
5556  const bool res_distributed = result_matrix.distributed();
5557 
5558  // Loop over all sub blocks.
5559  for(unsigned block_row_i = 0; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5560  {
5561  for(unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5562  {
5563  if(matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i) != 0)
5564  {
5565  const bool another_distributed
5566  = matrix_pt(block_row_i,block_col_i)->distributed();
5567 
5568  if(res_distributed != another_distributed)
5569  {
5570  std::ostringstream error_message;
5571  error_message
5572  << "The distributed boolean of the sub matrix ("
5573  << block_row_i << "," << block_col_i << ")\n"
5574  << "is not the same as the result matrix. \n";
5575  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5576  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5577  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5578  }
5579  }
5580  }
5581  }
5582 
5583  // Do this test for row_distribution_pt
5584  const bool first_row_distribution_distributed
5585  = row_distribution_pt[0]->distributed();
5586 
5587  for (unsigned block_row_i = 1; block_row_i < matrix_nrow; block_row_i++)
5588  {
5589  const bool another_distributed
5590  = row_distribution_pt[block_row_i]->distributed();
5591 
5592  if(first_row_distribution_distributed != another_distributed)
5593  {
5594  std::ostringstream error_message;
5595  error_message
5596  << "The distributed boolean of row_distribution_pt["
5597  << block_row_i << "]\n"
5598  << "is not the same as the one from row_distribution_pt[0]. \n";
5599  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5600  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5601  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5602  }
5603  }
5604 
5605  // Repeat for col_distribution_pt
5606  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5607  {
5608  const bool another_distributed
5609  = col_distribution_pt[block_col_i]->distributed();
5610 
5611  if(first_row_distribution_distributed != another_distributed)
5612  {
5613  std::ostringstream error_message;
5614  error_message
5615  << "The distributed boolean of col_distribution_pt["
5616  << block_col_i << "]\n"
5617  << "is not the same as the one from row_distribution_pt[0]. \n";
5618  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5619  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5620  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5621  }
5622  }
5623  }
5624 #endif
5625 
5626  ////////////////// END OF PARANOID TESTS ////////////////////////////////////
5627 
5628  // The number of processors.
5629  unsigned nproc = comm_pt->nproc();
5630 
5631  // Cache the result distribution pointer for convenience.
5632  LinearAlgebraDistribution* res_distribution_pt
5633  = result_matrix.distribution_pt();
5634 
5635  // nrow_local for the result matrix
5636  unsigned res_nrow_local = res_distribution_pt->nrow_local();
5637 
5638  // renamed for readability.
5639  unsigned nblock_col = matrix_ncol;
5640 
5641  // construct the block offset
5642 // DenseMatrix<unsigned> col_offset(nproc,nblock_col,0);
5643  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned> > col_offset(
5644  nproc,
5645  std::vector<unsigned>(nblock_col));
5646  unsigned off = 0;
5647  for (unsigned proc_i = 0; proc_i < nproc; proc_i++)
5648  {
5649  for (unsigned block_i = 0; block_i < nblock_col; block_i++)
5650  {
5651  col_offset[proc_i][block_i] = off;
5652  off +=col_distribution_pt[block_i]->nrow_local(proc_i);
5653  }
5654  }
5655 
5656  // Do some pre-processing for the processor number a global row number is
5657  // on. This is required when permuting the column entries.
5658  // We need to do this for each distribution, so we have a vector of
5659  // vectors. First index corresponds to the distribution, the second is
5660  // the processor number.
5661  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned> > p_for_rows(
5662  nblock_col,std::vector<unsigned>());
5663  // initialise 2D vector
5664  for (unsigned blocki = 0; blocki < nblock_col; blocki++)
5665  {
5666  int blockinrow = col_distribution_pt[blocki]->nrow();
5667  p_for_rows[blocki].resize(blockinrow);
5668  // FOR each global index in the block, work out the corresponding proc.
5669  for (int rowi = 0; rowi < blockinrow; rowi++)
5670  {
5671  unsigned p = 0;
5672  int b_first_row = col_distribution_pt[blocki]->first_row(p);
5673  int b_nrow_local = col_distribution_pt[blocki]->nrow_local(p);
5674 
5675  while (rowi < b_first_row ||
5676  rowi >= b_nrow_local + b_first_row)
5677  {
5678  p++;
5679  b_first_row = col_distribution_pt[blocki]->first_row(p);
5680  b_nrow_local = col_distribution_pt[blocki]->nrow_local(p);
5681  }
5682  p_for_rows[blocki][rowi] = p;
5683  }
5684  }
5685 
5686  // determine nnz of all blocks on this processor only.
5687  // This is used to create storage space.
5688  unsigned long res_nnz = 0;
5689  for (unsigned row_i = 0; row_i < nblock_row; row_i++)
5690  {
5691  for (unsigned col_i = 0; col_i < nblock_col; col_i++)
5692  {
5693  if(matrix_pt(row_i,col_i) !=0)
5694  {
5695  res_nnz += matrix_pt(row_i,col_i)->nnz();
5696  }
5697  }
5698  }
5699 
5700  // My rank
5701 // unsigned my_rank = comm_pt->my_rank();
5702 // my_rank = my_rank;
5703 
5704  // Turn the above into a string.
5705 // std::ostringstream myrankstream;
5706 // myrankstream << "THISDOESNOTHINGnp" << my_rank << std::endl;
5707 // std::string myrankstring = myrankstream.str();
5708 
5709 
5710 //CALLGRIND_ZERO_STATS;
5711 //CALLGRIND_START_INSTRUMENTATION;
5712 
5713  // storage for the result matrix.
5714  int* res_row_start = new int[res_nrow_local+1];
5715  int* res_column_index = new int[res_nnz];
5716  double* res_value = new double[res_nnz];
5717 
5718  // initialise the zero-th entry
5719  res_row_start[0] = 0;
5720 
5721  // loop over the block rows
5722  unsigned long res_i = 0; // index for the result matrix.
5723  unsigned long res_row_i = 0; // index for the row
5724  for (unsigned i = 0; i < nblock_row; i++)
5725  {
5726  // loop over the rows of the current block local rows.
5727  unsigned block_nrow = row_distribution_pt[i]->nrow_local();
5728  for (unsigned k = 0; k < block_nrow; k++)
5729  {
5730  // initialise res_row_start
5731  res_row_start[res_row_i+1] = res_row_start[res_row_i];
5732 
5733  // Loop over the block columns
5734  for (unsigned j = 0; j < nblock_col; j++)
5735  {
5736  // if block(i,j) pointer is not null then
5737  if (matrix_pt(i,j) != 0)
5738  {
5739  // get pointers for the elements in the current block
5740  int* b_row_start = matrix_pt(i,j)->row_start();
5741  int* b_column_index = matrix_pt(i,j)->column_index();
5742  double* b_value = matrix_pt(i,j)->value();
5743 
5744  //memcpy( &dst[dstIdx], &src[srcIdx], numElementsToCopy * sizeof( Element ) );
5745  // no ele to copy
5746  int numEleToCopy = b_row_start[k+1] - b_row_start[k];
5747  memcpy(res_value+res_i,b_value+b_row_start[k],numEleToCopy*sizeof(double));
5748  // Loop through the current local row.
5749  for (int l = b_row_start[k]; l < b_row_start[k+1]; l++)
5750  {
5751  // if b_column_index[l] was a row index, what processor
5752  // would it be on
5753 // unsigned p = col_distribution_pt[j]
5754 // ->rank_of_global_row_map(b_column_index[l]);
5755  unsigned p = p_for_rows[j][b_column_index[l]];
5756 
5757  int b_first_row = col_distribution_pt[j]->first_row(p);
5758 // int b_nrow_local = col_distribution_pt[j]->nrow_local(p);
5759 
5760 // while (b_column_index[l] < b_first_row ||
5761 // b_column_index[l] >= b_nrow_local+b_first_row)
5762 // {
5763 // p++;
5764 // b_first_row = col_distribution_pt[j]->first_row(p);
5765 // b_nrow_local = col_distribution_pt[j]->nrow_local(p);
5766 // }
5767 
5768  // determine the local equation number in the block j/processor p
5769  // "column block"
5770  int eqn = b_column_index[l]-b_first_row;
5771 
5772  // add to the result matrix
5773 // res_value[res_i] = b_value[l];
5774  res_column_index[res_i] = col_offset[p][j]+eqn;
5775  res_row_start[res_row_i+1]++;
5776  res_i++;
5777  }
5778  }
5779  }
5780 
5781  // increment the row pt
5782  res_row_i++;
5783 
5784  }
5785  }
5786 //CALLGRIND_STOP_INSTRUMENTATION;
5787 //CALLGRIND_DUMP_STATS_AT(myrankstring.c_str());
5788 
5789 
5790  // Get the number of columns of the result matrix.
5791  unsigned res_ncol = 0;
5792  for (unsigned block_col_i = 0; block_col_i < matrix_ncol; block_col_i++)
5793  {
5794  res_ncol += col_distribution_pt[block_col_i]->nrow();
5795  }
5796 
5797  // Build the result matrix.
5798  result_matrix.build_without_copy(res_ncol,res_nnz,
5799  res_value,
5800  res_column_index,
5801  res_row_start);
5802  }
5803 
5804 
5805 
5806  //============================================================================
5807  /// \short Concatenate CRDoubleMatrix matrices.
5808  /// This calls the other concatenate_without_communication(...) function,
5809  /// passing block_distribution_pt as both the row_distribution_pt and
5810  /// col_distribution_pt. This should only be called for block square matrices.
5811  //============================================================================
5812  void concatenate_without_communication(
5813  const Vector<LinearAlgebraDistribution*> &block_distribution_pt,
5814  const DenseMatrix<CRDoubleMatrix*> &matrix_pt,
5815  CRDoubleMatrix &result_matrix)
5816  {
5817 
5818 #ifdef PARANOID
5819  // The number of block rows and block columns.
5820  unsigned matrix_nrow = matrix_pt.nrow();
5821  unsigned matrix_ncol = matrix_pt.ncol();
5822 
5823  // Are there matrices to concatenate?
5824  if(matrix_nrow == 0)
5825  {
5826  std::ostringstream error_message;
5827  error_message << "There are no matrices to concatenate.\n";
5828  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5829  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5830  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5831  }
5832 
5833  // Ensure that the sub matrices is a square block matrix.
5834  if(matrix_nrow != matrix_ncol)
5835  {
5836  std::ostringstream error_message;
5837  error_message<<"The number of block rows and block columns\n"
5838  <<"must be the same. Otherwise, call the other\n"
5839  <<"concatenate_without_communication function, passing in\n"
5840  <<"a Vector of distributions describing how to permute the\n"
5841  <<"columns.";
5842  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
5843  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5844  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5845  }
5846 #endif
5847 
5848  concatenate_without_communication(
5849  block_distribution_pt,block_distribution_pt,matrix_pt,result_matrix);
5850  }
5851 
5852 } // CRDoubleMatrixHelpers
5853 
5854 } // namespace oomph
